recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Classic Chicken Piccata
recipe.description: A classic Italian-American dish featuring tender chicken breast cutlets cooked in a zesty lemon-butter caper sauce. This light and flavorful dish is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and pounded until 1/4 inch thick
Couscous or angel hair pasta (for serving)

steps: Cut one lemon in half lengthwise. Trim the ends from one half and cut across into thin slices about 1/8 inch thick; set aside. Juice the remaining half and whole lemon to obtain about 1/4 cup juice; set aside.
Season both sides of the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place flour into a shallow dish or pan. Coat each breast with flour, and shake to remove excess.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat until hot, about 2 minutes. Cook half the batch in the skillet without moving them until lightly browned on the first side, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Turn and cook until the second side is lightly browned, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes longer. Transfer to a plate kept warm in the oven, or cover with aluminum foil. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet and heat until shimmering. Add remaining chicken pieces and repeat. Add cooked chicken to previous batch and keep warm in 200-degree oven.

Using the pan in which you cooked the chicken, saut√© the shallots in the oil and browned bits remaining in the pan. Once shallots become translucent, add the chicken broth and lemon slices. Allow to cook until lemon slices are well-softened.

Add the capers and lemon juice, and allow to reduce to concentrate flavors. Remove pan from heat and swirl in the butter until it melts and thickens the sauce. Swirl in the parsley. Spoon over chicken and serve immediately over a bed of couscous or angel hair pasta.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Pumpkin, and Sage Stew
recipe.description: A hearty and comforting one-dish meal featuring chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and fresh sage. This cozy autumnal stew is easy to prepare with pantry staples and is perfect for chilly evenings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta like orzo

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped carrot, onion, and sage leaves. Saut√© until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and chicken broth. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipe.name: Double Chocolate Espresso Cookies
recipe.description: Rich and decadent chocolate cookies with a kick of espresso, perfect for grown-ups and special occasions. Crisp on the edges and chewy in the middle, these cookies are best enjoyed with a glass of milk.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞ F.
Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Then, add eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder.
With the mixer on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Drop dough by rounded teaspoon onto the sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

recipe.name: Nik Sharma's Spicy Chocolate Chip‚ÄìHazelnut Cookies
recipe.description: A one-bowl, crisp-chewy cookie that is gluten-free, with hazelnut flour, jaggery, bittersweet chocolate, and a kick of black pepper. Inspired by Nutella, this cookie balances spicy, nutty, and chocolate flavors.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the hazelnut meal, jaggery, baking powder, baking soda, black pepper, and salt.
Add the egg, melted butter, hazelnut extract, chocolate, and ginger, and stir with a large wooden spoon until the dough comes together.
Grease your hands with a little oil to prevent the dough from sticking. Divide the dough into twelve equal parts and shape them into balls. Flatten them into 2-inch (5 cm) rounds.
Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Wrap the entire baking sheet tightly in plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 10 minutes, preferably 2 hours.
To bake, preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (180¬∞C). Line a second baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the baking sheet from the freezer and put half the rounds of dough on the second sheet. Spread out the rounds on both baking sheets and refrigerate one of them.
Bake one batch of cookies at a time until golden brown, about 12 to 15 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks.

recipe.name: Scrambled Red Shakshuka from Sami Tamimi & Tara Wigley
recipe.description: A bright, saucy scrambled egg dish inspired by Sami Tamimi's childhood in Palestine. Eggs are gently scrambled into a base of red bell pepper and tomatoes, creating a comforting and flavorful shakshuka that's perfect for breakfast or brunch.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo chile flakes or red pepper flakes
Coriander seeds, lightly toasted and crushed
Yellow or white onion, thinly sliced
Red bell pepper, seeded and cut into long slices
Cumin seeds, lightly toasted and crushed
Salt and black pepper to taste

steps: Place the feta in a bowl with parsley, 1/2 teaspoon of chile flakes, 3 tablespoons of oil, and 1/2 teaspoon of coriander seeds. Mix well and set aside.
Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large saut√© pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, until softened and lightly browned.
Add the bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the garlic, cumin seeds, tomato paste, paprika, and the remaining coriander seeds. Cook for another 1 minute until fragrant.
Add all the tomatoes, shatta, water, 1 teaspoon of salt, and a generous grind of black pepper. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes until the tomatoes break down and the sauce thickens.
Add salt and pepper to the eggs and mix well. Slowly pour the eggs into the tomato mixture, swirling the pan and folding gently. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan, and cook for 4 minutes.
Remove from heat, spoon the marinated feta on top, sprinkle with remaining chile flakes, and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Gochujang-Yogurt Chicken with Garlic Butter Rice
recipe.description: A tangy, spicy chicken dish with creamy garlic butter rice, combining gochujang-marinated chicken with savory garlic rice for a perfect, flavorful meal.
steps: In a bowl, combine the gochujang, yogurt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the remaining clove of minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the chicken stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit, covered, for 10 minutes.

Preheat the broiler and set a rack 6 inches from the heat. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place on the rack. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes per side, until charred and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Thin with a little water, if needed, to reach a drizzly consistency.
To serve, divide the rice among plates. Top with lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes, and the broiled chicken. Drizzle with the lemon-mayo sauce.

recipe.name: Simple Cheese Souffl√©
recipe.description: An easy, light, and flavorful cheese souffl√© made with Gruy√®re, perfect for a mid-week family meal. This unfussy dish is best served with a simple green salad for an elegant yet simple lunch or dinner.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Butter a 7" souffl√© dish and coat it with grated Parmesan cheese.
Whip egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks until smooth.
Melt butter over low heat, add flour, and whisk to blend. Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thick and smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in the cheese and egg yolks. Fold in the stiff egg whites carefully.
Pour the mixture into the buttered souffl√© dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the souffl√© is puffed and golden. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Stir-Fried Udon with Bacon, Parmesan & Gochujang
recipe.description: A fusion dish combining elements from Korean, Japanese, and Italian cuisines. This stir-fried udon features thick-cut bacon, gochujang, Parmesan, and egg yolks for a savory, spicy, and creamy pasta experience.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the udon.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the bacon, scallions, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Saute until the bacon is golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Lower the skillet heat, add soy sauce and gochujang, and stir to coat the bacon mixture.
Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and add the noodles to the skillet. Toss to combine with the bacon and gochujang sauce.
Mix 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved udon water into the egg-cheese mixture to form a sauce. Add the udon and toss to coat.
Season with more salt and pepper if needed, drizzle with sesame oil, and serve garnished with scallions.

recipe.name: Best Chicken Stew
recipe.description: A hearty chicken stew made with tender Yukon gold potatoes, carrots, celery, and seasoned chicken, simmered in a rich broth of rosemary, thyme, and garlic. Perfect for cold-weather comfort meals.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Yukon gold potatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces

steps: Heat oil in a large pot. Sear the chicken until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Remove and cut into bite-sized pieces.
In the same pot, cook onion and garlic for about 3 minutes until softened. Add the rosemary and thyme, cooking for another 2 minutes.
Add carrots and celery, cooking until translucent, about 8 minutes.
Stir in the flour and cook for 3 minutes to coat the vegetables. Gradually add the chicken stock, stirring to break up lumps of flour.
Add the chicken, potatoes, and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce to medium-low, and simmer for about 20 minutes until the chicken and potatoes are tender.
Adjust seasonings and discard the thyme and rosemary sprigs. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipe.name: Cold Salmon & Potatoes with Dill Yogurt & Paprika Oil
recipe.description: A refreshing, make-ahead dish with tender slow-roasted salmon, boiled yellow potatoes, a bright dill yogurt sauce, and smoky paprika oil for added depth of flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Small yellow potatoes, halved or quartered

steps: Preheat the oven to 275¬∞F. Sprinkle salmon with salt, drizzle olive oil on a baking dish, and roast the salmon for 15 to 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until it reaches 120¬∞F. Let cool to warm, then refrigerate until cold.
Boil salted water and cook the potatoes until tender, 8 to 12 minutes. Drain and let cool.
Heat olive oil in a small pan. Remove from heat and stir in smoked paprika and salt. Set aside.
Blend yogurt with 2/3 cup of dill until smooth and green. Season with salt.
To serve, spread dill yogurt on plates, add flaked salmon and potatoes on top. Drizzle with paprika oil and sprinkle with remaining dill.

recipe.name: Roasted Root Vegetables with Spicy Tahini Sauce
recipe.description: A flavorful dish of roasted root vegetables with a spicy, creamy tahini sauce, topped with toasted nuts and seeds for added crunch. A perfect vegetarian side or main dish for a hearty meal.
steps: Arrange a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350¬∞F. Place the beets and sweet potatoes on a rimmed baking sheet and bake until tender, about 60 to 80 minutes. Once done, remove from the oven and let them cool.

Increase the oven temperature to 475¬∞F. Break the cooled sweet potatoes into 3-inch pieces and place them on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with 3 tablespoons of olive oil, sprinkle with salt, and roast for an additional 20 to 30 minutes, until browned.
Peel and trim the beets once cooled, and cut them into small wedges. Set them aside in a bowl.

For the tahini sauce: In a blender, combine tahini, lime juice, garlic, basil, mint, habanero, 2 teaspoons of salt, and ¬æ cup water. Blend until smooth, adjusting with water to achieve a sour cream-like consistency.
In a skillet, toast peanuts, pistachios, and pepitas until lightly charred. Add sesame seeds, cumin, coriander, and chile de √°rbol, toasting until golden brown.
Toss beet greens and poblano strips in lime juice and olive oil. To serve, spread tahini sauce on a plate, arrange roasted vegetables on top, and garnish with the nut mixture and sliced serrano.

recipe.name: Best Korean Fried Chicken
recipe.description: Crispy and flavorful Korean fried chicken with a soy garlic sauce. The chicken is double-fried to perfection, offering extra crunch, and tossed in a sweet, spicy, and savory glaze.
steps: In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper. Transfer to a large zip-top bag, add potato starch, and shake to coat the chicken evenly.
Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a deep pan to 340¬∞F. Fry the chicken in batches for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown. Drain on a rack or strainer.
Return the oil to 340¬∞F and re-fry the chicken for an additional 10-13 minutes until crispy. Drain again.
To make the sauce, heat oil in a pan, add chiles, garlic, and ginger, cooking until fragrant. Stir in soy sauce, rice syrup, vinegar, and brown sugar, simmering until thickened.
Toss the fried chicken in the sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve.

recipe.name: Orzo Salad with Green Beans, Tomatoes, Feta & Mint
recipe.description: A bright, Mediterranean-inspired orzo salad with blistered green beans, burst tomatoes, creamy feta, and fresh mint, brought together with a touch of soy sauce for extra umami. Perfect as a side dish or a light meal.
steps: Boil a pot of salted water, add orzo, and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes. Drain and drizzle with olive oil. Set aside.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium-high. Add green beans, season with salt, and let them blister for about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and red pepper flakes, cooking until the tomatoes burst, about 5 more minutes.
Add soy sauce, then stir in the cooked orzo, lemon juice, and half of the feta. Let the feta melt slightly into the orzo.
Take the skillet off the heat, garnish with the remaining feta and fresh mint, and season with black pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

recipe.name: Ven Pongal (South Indian Rice & Lentil Dish)
recipe.description: A comforting South Indian dish made with rice and mung dal, flavored with black pepper, cumin, ghee, and cashews. Pongal is a popular breakfast staple often served with coconut chutney and sambar.
steps: Wash the rice in several changes of water until clear. Soak for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a pot over medium heat, dry roast the lentils for 2-3 minutes until golden and nutty. Wash them thoroughly.
Combine the rice, lentils, and 3¬Ω cups of water in a pot. Add ginger, turmeric, and 2 tablespoons of ghee. Bring to a boil, skim off foam, then cook over low heat for 20 minutes.
Add another ¬Ω cup of water and cook for 5 more minutes until creamy. Mash slightly to achieve a risotto-like texture.
Meanwhile, fry cashews in ghee until golden and set aside.
In the same pan, add cumin, pepper, and asafoetida to the remaining ghee, frying until fragrant. Pour this over the rice mixture.
Mix in coconut, salt, and the fried cashews, reserving some for garnish. Serve hot.

recipe.name: Roasted Tomato BLT Soup
recipe.description: A unique blend of roasted tomatoes, bacon, and fresh greens, this soup brings together the flavors of a classic BLT sandwich in a bowl. Topped with croutons, arugula, and a garlic mayonnaise drizzle, it‚Äôs perfect for any season and can be served hot, warm, or chilled.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Red wine vinegar or lemon juice

steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F. Halve or quarter the tomatoes and arrange on a baking sheet with the onions, garlic, and oregano. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally.

Cool the roasted vegetables slightly, peel the tomato skins if desired, and transfer the vegetables and juices to a large pot. Add chicken stock, sugar, red pepper flakes, vinegar, and basil. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Pur√©e the soup using an immersion blender until smooth. Adjust seasoning as needed.
Meanwhile, fry the diced bacon until crispy and set aside. Make the croutons by tossing the bread cubes with olive oil and toasting in the oven until golden.
Prepare the garlic mayonnaise by mashing two of the roasted garlic cloves and mixing with the mayonnaise.
Serve the soup with bacon bits, croutons, arugula, and a drizzle of garlic mayonnaise.

recipe.name: White Bean and Kale Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A hearty soup made with white beans, tender kale, and savory sausage, this comforting dish is perfect for cold days. Flavored with rosemary, garlic, and a splash of white wine, it's a nourishing meal that‚Äôs easy to make and packed with flavor.
steps: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the shallots and saut√© until almost translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in the white wine and let it reduce slightly. Add the vegetable stock, beans, and rosemary. Bring to a boil, then add the chopped kale. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
While the soup cooks, brown the sausage in a separate pan. If using crumbled sausage, add it directly to the soup. For linked sausage, slice and stir into the soup.
Taste the soup and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Serve topped with grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Mushroom Thyme Gravy
recipe.description: A rich and savory vegetarian gravy made with dried mushrooms, fresh thyme, and a touch of sherry. Perfect for topping mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or even as a sauce for vegetarian mains.
steps: Bring the vegetable stock to a boil and pour it over the dried mushrooms. Let them soak for 20 minutes, then remove the mushrooms and mince or slice them thinly, reserving the stock.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter and saut√© the shallot for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the flour to the butter and shallots, stirring constantly for 2 minutes to cook the flour.
Gradually stir in 1 1/2 cups of the reserved mushroom stock. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the minced mushrooms, soy sauce, cream, sherry, and thyme. Cook until heated through and thickened to the desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipe.name: Northern Spy's Kale Salad
recipe.description: A hearty kale salad with roasted squash, almonds, aged cheddar, and lemon dressing, this dish brings together bold flavors and textures. Perfect for a fall meal or a refreshing side.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Kale (lacinato or dinosaur), ribs removed and finely sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Toss the squash cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a baking sheet for about 40 minutes, turning occasionally until tender and caramelized.
In a large bowl, toss the kale with the roasted squash, almonds, and cheddar. Dress with lemon juice and a drizzle of olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Top with shaved pecorino if desired, and serve.

recipe.name: Punjabi-Style Chicken Curry
recipe.description: A robust and flavorful chicken curry with rich spices like garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder. The chicken is marinated in yogurt and cooked to perfection in a tomato and onion base.
steps: Marinate the chicken in yogurt, salt, spices, garlic, and ginger. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and bay leaf. Once they start to sizzle, add the onions and cook until golden brown, about 15 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Stir in the ground spices and cook for 1 minute.
Add the marinated chicken and mix well. Cover and cook over low heat for 40-45 minutes, until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.
Let the curry rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour to enhance the flavors. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve.

recipe.name: Honey Mustard Chicken
recipe.description: A classic honey-mustard chicken dish that balances sweetness and tang. Perfect for a simple weeknight meal or dressed up for guests. Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a complete meal.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. Mix all the marinade ingredients (olive oil to red pepper flakes) in a bowl.
Coat the chicken breast with the marinade, cover, and let rest for 10 minutes or overnight.
Heat oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes on one side, then flip and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 15-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165¬∞F. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with fresh corn panzanella for a balanced meal.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Farro with Fennel, Tomatoes & Parmesan
recipe.description: A savory and aromatic dish that combines nutty farro with sweet fennel, cherry tomatoes, and a touch of anchovy. Finished with a bright fennel frond pesto and Parmesan, it‚Äôs a simple, flavorful one-pan meal.
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the anchovy and stir until it dissolves into the oil. Add the farro and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.

Add the stock, lemon zest, fennel, garlic, cherry tomatoes, salt, and chile flakes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes until the farro is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
While the farro is cooking, make the fennel frond pesto: chop fennel fronds with pine nuts and Parmesan, then mix with olive oil and lemon juice.
Once the farro is done, spoon the fennel frond pesto over the top while still in the skillet. Garnish with more Parmesan and serve warm.

recipe.name: Orecchiette With Bacony Collards & Cannellini Beans
recipe.description: A hearty pasta with orecchiette, bacon-cooked collards, and cannellini beans. This one-pot dish features tender greens, creamy beans, and a unique pasta-soaking technique, making it easy to prepare.
steps: Cover the pasta in 1.5 cups of stock, stirring occasionally to prevent clumping.
Add bacon and 2 tbsp water to a Dutch oven. Cook over medium heat until bacon is browned and crisp, 12-15 mins.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes to bacon fat, cooking until aromatic. Add collards, remaining stock, salt, and pepper.
Simmer partially covered until greens are tender, 40-45 mins. Add beans, adjust seasoning.
Add soaked pasta and its liquid, simmer until al dente, 3-5 mins.
Remove from heat, add Parmesan, butter, and bacon, stir well. Serve garnished with more cheese.

recipe.name: Creamy Tortellini Soup with Sausage
recipe.description: A rich and comforting soup with cheese tortellini, Italian sausage, bell pepper, and a creamy tomato broth. Perfect for a cozy meal.
steps: Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium heat. Add bell pepper, saut√© for 5 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, sage, paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Break up the meat and cook until browned, 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and pur√©ed tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add tortellini, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan. Simmer for 1 minute, adjust seasoning, and serve with thyme.

recipe.name: Tahini-Rubbed Chicken With Chickpeas & Dates
recipe.description: An easy one-skillet meal with tahini-rubbed chicken, caramelized dates, chickpeas, and lemon. Perfect for a savory, sticky pan sauce with Middle Eastern flavors.
steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F.
Mix tahini, olive oil, honey, cumin, and paprika in a small bowl until smooth.
Rub chicken with tahini mixture, season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix honey and hot water; soak lemon slices.
Layer onion, chickpeas, half the lemon slices, and oil in a skillet; season.
Add chicken, arrange remaining lemon around it. Roast for 20 minutes.
Add dates around chicken, roast another 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165¬∞F.
Broil for crisp skin if desired. Stir herbs into chickpeas and onions.
Combine yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, and salt.
Serve chicken and dates with chickpeas, yogurt sauce, and flatbread.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Chicken With Tomato and Turmeric Rice
recipe.description: A flavorful one-skillet meal with tender chicken thighs, spiced rice, and tomatoes. This recipe combines warming spices and is perfect for easy weeknight dinners.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, coriander, cumin, and paprika.
Heat olive oil in an ovenproof skillet. Sear chicken until golden, about 5 minutes per side. Set aside.
Saut√© onion and garlic, add rice and turmeric. Toast rice for 3 minutes.
Add tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, stock, and remaining salt. Simmer.
Return chicken, cover, and bake for 30-35 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

recipe.name: Big Fat Halloumi Salad
recipe.description: A vibrant salad with roasted eggplant, chickpeas, crispy Halloumi, greens, and a tangy honey-sumac dressing. A satisfying Middle Eastern-inspired dish perfect for any meal.
steps: Preheat oven to 450¬∞F and place a sheet pan inside.
Toss eggplant with oil, salt, and sugar. Roast 15 minutes.
Add chickpeas and Halloumi, continue roasting until eggplant is tender and Halloumi is crisp, about 10 minutes.
Whisk dressing ingredients and toss with arugula, radicchio, and parsley.
Top with roasted items, almonds, dates, and tangerine slices. Serve.

recipe.name: Honey-Mustard Chicken with Raw Corn Panzanella
recipe.description: A juicy baked honey-mustard chicken breast served with a fresh corn panzanella salad featuring sourdough, tomatoes, and a tangy dressing.
steps: Preheat your oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, thyme, mustard powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Place the chicken breast in a shallow dish and pour half of the marinade over it, turning the chicken to coat evenly. Let it marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and sear the marinated chicken breast on each side for about 3 minutes, until golden brown.

Transfer the seared chicken to an oven-safe dish, pour any remaining marinade from the skillet over it, and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165¬∞F (74¬∞C). Remove from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
While the chicken is baking, prepare the Panzanella. Cut the sourdough bread into cubes, then toast them in a dry skillet over medium heat until they are golden and crisp, about 5 minutes.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn kernels, halved grape tomatoes, grated garlic, and toasted sourdough bread cubes.
Pour the remaining half of the marinade over the corn and bread mixture, tossing gently to coat everything evenly.
To serve, place the corn Panzanella on a plate, then slice the chicken and arrange it on top. Drizzle any extra pan juices over the chicken, if desired, and enjoy!

recipe.name: Miso-Ginger Noodles With Tuna & Spicy Sesame Crumbs
recipe.description: Saucy, umami-rich noodles with tender greens, canned tuna, and a topping of spicy sesame crumbs. Quick to make and deeply flavorful.
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Cook noodles per package instructions; drain.
Prepare the dressing by mixing miso, warm water, ginger, vinegar, oils, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Toss noodles with 3/4 of the dressing, greens, and tuna. Add remaining dressing if desired.
In a skillet, heat oil and toast panko, sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes until golden. Sprinkle with salt.
Serve noodles topped with sesame crumbs.

recipe.name: Zucchini Verde Vegan Enchiladas
recipe.description: Vegan enchiladas packed with zucchini, poblano, black beans, and topped with a cashew lime cream. A satisfying, plant-based meal with zesty flavors.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F.
Blend cashews, water, garlic, lime juice, and salt until smooth. Chill until ready to use.
Heat oil in a skillet, saut√© onion, poblano, and salt for 5 minutes. Add zucchini, coriander, and cumin, cooking 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic, black beans, and tofu. Remove from heat.
Brush baking dish with oil, spread salsa. Fill tortillas with filling, arrange seam-side down, top with salsa. Bake 25 minutes.
Drizzle with cashew cream, top with red onion, radishes, avocado, and cilantro. Serve with lime slices.

recipe.name: Ropa Vieja
recipe.description: A classic Cuban dish of shredded beef, simmered with bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and spices for a flavorful, slow-cooked meal.
steps: Season the beef with salt and pepper generously.
In a large pot over high heat, warm the oil and sear the beef until browned on all sides. Set aside.
In the same pot, cook the onions and peppers over medium heat for 15-20 minutes until caramelized. Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and oregano. Stir until fragrant.
Add the wine, scraping the pan to deglaze. Add beef broth and tomatoes, bringing to a simmer.
Return beef to the pot, cover, and cook on low heat for 2-3 hours until fork-tender.
Remove beef, shred, and return to the pot. Add olives (optional) and simmer for 30 minutes to thicken.
Stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve over white rice.

recipe.name: Beef Short Rib Bourguignon With Garlicky Panko Gremolata
recipe.description: A rich and comforting beef bourguignon with short ribs, mushrooms, and carrots, topped with a crunchy panko gremolata.
steps: Preheat oven to 325¬∞F. Season ribs with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in an oven-safe pot. Sear ribs until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add shallots, garlic, tomato paste, red pepper flakes, herbes de Provence, and bay leaf to the pot. Saut√© for 1 minute.
Pour in wine, reduce for 3-5 minutes. Add water, Worcestershire, and return ribs to the pot.
Cover and bake for 1.5 hours.
Toast panko, mix with garlic, lemon zest, parsley, and oil for gremolata.
Add mushrooms and carrots to pot, bake 30 minutes more. Serve with gremolata.

recipe.name: Mozzarella Schnitzel
recipe.description: A crispy, golden breaded mozzarella dish inspired by schnitzel. Perfect for a quick snack, appetizer, or as a fun twist on mozzarella sticks.
steps: Stack mozzarella slices to 3/4 cm height; press to adhere.
Prepare dredging stations: flour, whisked egg, seasoned panko.
Heat oil in skillet on medium-high. Dredge cheese in flour, egg, then panko, pressing firmly.
Test oil with a panko piece; it should sizzle immediately.
Fry mozzarella 2-3 minutes until golden, flip, and cook another 1-2 minutes.
Drain on paper towel and serve hot.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Vegetable Beef Soup
recipe.description: A comforting Instant Pot soup with ground beef, vegetables, and spices, perfect for cozy weeknights.
steps: In the Instant Pot, turn on the Saut√© function, add olive oil, and saut√© ground beef until browned. Add onion and garlic, cooking another 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, soy sauce, oregano, celery seed, and bay leaves. Cook briefly until fragrant.
Add carrots, beef stock, and diced tomatoes. Lock the lid and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes.
After cooking, stir in peas and green beans, letting them heat through. Add vinegar, adjust salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe.name: Mole Sencillo
recipe.description: A simplified yet flavorful mole sauce made with ancho chiles, nuts, and chocolate for a rich, smoky, and slightly sweet taste.
steps: Char tomato and onion in a hot skillet until blackened on all sides.
Heat lard, fry chiles until toasted, and set aside. Fry crackers, almonds, raisins, sesame seeds, and anise until golden and aromatic.
Add salt, sugar, water, chiles, crackers, tomato, and onion; simmer for 30 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Reheat blended mole in lard, stir in chocolate, and adjust seasoning. Serve with toasted sesame seeds.

recipe.name: Burnt Broccoli Farro with Smashed Olives
recipe.description: Nutty farro with charred broccoli, smashed olives, feta, and a tahini-lime dressing for a Mediterranean-inspired meal.
steps: Cook farro in salted water until tender; drain.
Pickle red onion in lime juice with salt.
Char broccoli and olives in oil, season with pepper flakes.
Mix lime juice, tahini, and oil for dressing. Toss with farro, broccoli, olives, and feta. Top with pickled onions.

recipe.name: Chicken Florentine by Joanna Gaines
recipe.description: A classic one-skillet Chicken Florentine with creamy sauce, spinach, and a hint of lemon.
steps: Heat olive oil in skillet, season chicken with pepper and 2 tsp salt, dredge in flour.
Cook chicken until golden, about 8 mins per side, then set aside.
Reduce heat, melt butter, add shallots and garlic, saut√© until soft.
Add wine, simmer to reduce by half, then add cream, cooking until thickened.
Stir in spinach and remaining salt until wilted.
Slice chicken, return to skillet, garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Grilled Ribs With Salt & Pepper
recipe.description: Simple, flavorful grilled ribs seasoned with just salt and pepper for a deliciously charred and juicy finish.
steps: Generously season ribs with salt and pepper.
Preheat grill to high and cook ribs, turning occasionally, until slightly charred and internal temperature reaches 145¬∞F.
Serve hot with rice or a side of choice.

recipe.name: Pizza Party Strata
recipe.description: A savory, pizza-inspired strata with garlic bread, pepperoni, mozzarella, and marinara. Ideal for breakfast or brunch.
steps: Heat the oven to 350¬∞F and grease a high-sided 10-inch skillet or 9x9-inch baking dish with olive oil.
Spread cubed garlic bread on a sheet pan and toast until lightly browned, about 10-12 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs until smooth. Add milk, salt, red pepper flakes, and oregano, whisking to combine.
Add pepperoni and all but a handful of mozzarella, mixing with a spatula to combine.
Fold in toasted bread cubes until moistened, then transfer to the prepared pan. Dollop marinara on top and sprinkle remaining mozzarella.
Chill for up to 24 hours or bake immediately. Bake at 350¬∞F for 45 minutes until puffed and golden.
Garnish with Parmesan, basil, and serve with additional marinara if desired.

recipe.name: One-Pan Crispy Chicken Thighs With Roasted Potatoes, Zucchini & Tomatoes
recipe.description: A simple and flavorful one-pan meal with crispy chicken thighs, golden potatoes, and caramelized summer vegetables.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken skin-side down to skillet and cook until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Flip and cook for 5 minutes on the other side. Remove from skillet.
Add potatoes to the skillet and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden.
Add zucchini and cook for 5 minutes until it begins to caramelize.
Add tomatoes, garlic, and oregano, stirring gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
Return chicken to the skillet, place in the oven, and roast for 10 minutes, or until chicken reaches 165¬∞F.
Garnish with remaining oregano and optional lemon juice.

recipe.name: Herby Mushroom Stew
recipe.description: A vegetarian-friendly stew with golden-brown mushrooms cooked in a rich broth with red wine, soy sauce, and aromatic spices. Perfect served over rice or mashed potatoes.
steps: Heat 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add mushrooms and cook without stirring until golden-brown. Transfer to a bowl and repeat with remaining mushrooms.
Add remaining olive oil to the pot. Lower heat to medium, then add shallots and carrot, cooking until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and tomato paste, cooking for 3 minutes until fragrant. Stir in flour, coating vegetables, and cook for 2 minutes.

Add cooked mushrooms back to the pot along with red wine, stock, soy sauce, smoked paprika, hot or sweet paprika, coriander, and balsamic vinegar. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 50-60 minutes until thickened.
Season with kosher salt, garnish with parsley, and serve over rice, mashed potatoes, or couscous.

recipe.name: Risotto alla Carbonara
recipe.description: A creamy, indulgent risotto inspired by classic pasta carbonara, featuring guanciale, egg yolk, and Pecorino Romano.
steps: Starting from a cold pan, heat the guanciale in olive oil until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, saut√© shallots, then add rice and toast for 1 minute. Add vermouth and reduce completely.
Slowly add hot chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring until absorbed, about 16 minutes. Check if rice is al dente.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg yolk, cream, pepper, and cheese.
Fold the egg mixture into the risotto, mixing until creamy. Top with guanciale, Pecorino shavings, and black pepper.

recipe.name: Jean's Kimchi Fried Rice with Nori
recipe.description: A comforting kimchi fried rice made with crispy Spam, ripe kimchi, and a topping of crushed nori. Served with a runny fried egg for the ultimate savory meal.
steps: Heat sesame oil in a large nonstick pan or wok over medium heat.
Add diced Spam and cook until crispy, then add kimchi (reserve juice) and saut√© until fragrant and darker in color.
Add rice, breaking it up with a spoon, and pour in kimchi juice, soy sauce, and additional oil if needed. Stir continuously for 5-10 minutes until well-combined and slightly toasted.
Mix in crushed seaweed, then serve each portion with a fried egg on top.

recipe.name: Cornbread Strata with Cheddar & Jalape√±os
recipe.description: A savory strata with cornbread, sharp cheddar, jalape√±os, and scallions. Perfect for breakfast or brunch with a spicy kick.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Grease a high-sided baking dish with 1 tbsp butter.
Spread cubed cornbread on a baking sheet. Melt remaining butter and pour over cornbread, sprinkle smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat and toast for 10-12 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs, then add milk, salt, and pepper. Reserve a small amount of scallions for garnish.
Add corn, jalape√±os, remaining scallions, grated garlic, and most of the cheese to the bowl. Stir to combine.
Fold in toasted cornbread, ensuring all pieces are moistened. Transfer mixture to the baking dish, garnish with remaining cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes until golden and set. Let cool slightly before serving with yogurt or sour cream.

recipe.name: Slow Cooker Pasta e Fagioli
recipe.description: A comforting Italian-style soup with beans, pasta, and tomatoes, simmered in a slow cooker for a rich, savory flavor.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and saut√© onion, carrot, and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add thyme, rosemary, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Add tomatoes (broken into pieces), beans, stock, bay leaf, and Parmesan rind. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 5 hours.

If serving immediately, add pasta directly to the slow cooker and cook for 15 minutes. Alternatively, cook pasta separately and add to each bowl before serving to prevent it from absorbing too much broth.
Serve with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan, with crusty bread on the side if desired.

recipe.name: Cheesy Potato Soup with Peppered Scallions
recipe.description: A comforting, creamy potato soup topped with sharp cheese and a peppery, charred scallion garnish for added flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cr√®me fra√Æche, sour cream, or Greek yogurt

steps: Melt butter in a stockpot over medium heat. Saut√© onions for 5 minutes until translucent, then add garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Sprinkle in flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2-3 minutes.
Add cubed potatoes, milk, vegetable stock, salt, rosemary, and thyme. Simmer on medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender.

For the peppered scallion topping, coat scallions in olive oil and char them in a hot skillet, about 5 minutes. Remove, cool, and roughly chop. Toast butter in the skillet until browned, then add scallions, lemon zest, juice, and salt. Sizzle for 2 minutes and season with black pepper.
Remove herb stems from the soup, set aside a quarter of the potatoes, and blend the rest until smooth. Add the reserved potatoes for texture.
Stir in cheeses, smoked paprika, cayenne, and adjust salt. Serve with cr√®me fra√Æche or sour cream and a spoonful of peppered scallions.

recipe.name: Giambotta (Italian Summer Vegetable Stew)
recipe.description: A traditional Italian vegetable stew made with summer produce like potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. Perfect for using up fresh garden vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: white or yellow onion, finely chopped

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, eggplant, zucchini, green beans, and bell pepper. Stir to coat with oil.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and broth, stir, and cover. Simmer for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
Add cherry tomatoes and basil. Stir and cook uncovered for 2-3 minutes to let the tomatoes soften.
Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot or cold with grated cheese and day-old bread, if desired.

recipe.name: Turmeric Roast Chicken with Cardamom-Coconut Jasmine Rice
recipe.description: An aromatic roast chicken seasoned with turmeric and served alongside fragrant coconut jasmine rice infused with cardamom and bay leaf.
steps: Liberally season the spatchcocked chicken with salt and dry brine in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, up to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F. Grind turmeric and garlic with a pinch of salt into a paste, then mix with fish sauce, white pepper, chicken powder, lime juice, and sugar.
Rub the spice paste over the chicken, including under the skin. Place a butter plank under the skin of each breast and thigh.
Roast chicken in the oven for 1 hour, checking at 30 minutes. Tent breasts with foil if browning too quickly. Once cooked to 165¬∞F, let rest for 10 minutes.
To make the rice, heat coconut oil in a saucepan over medium-high. Add cardamom and bay leaf, bloom for 30 seconds, then coat rice and toast for 3 minutes.
Add salt, sugar, coconut water, and coconut milk. Stir once, bring to a simmer, then cover and cook on low for 20 minutes. Let rest for 5-10 minutes before fluffing.
Serve the roasted chicken over the coconut rice with a drizzle of pan drippings.

recipe.name: Weeknight Cassoulet
recipe.description: A simplified, quick take on traditional cassoulet, featuring Italian sausages, canned beans, and a crispy breadcrumb topping. Perfect for a cozy weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cans of cannellini or white northern beans (undrained)

steps: Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Prick sausages with a knife and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board.
Add onion, celery, and garlic to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add beans with their liquid, water, and additional salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Slice sausages and return to the skillet, then stir in vinegar and remove from heat.
Preheat the broiler with the rack in the top position. In a small bowl, mix panko, parsley, remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Scatter over beans and sausage.
Broil until the top is golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Porcini Mushroom Risotto
recipe.description: A creamy, savory risotto featuring fresh porcini mushrooms, Parmesan, and a touch of white wine. Perfect for cozy fall dinners.
steps: In a medium skillet over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp of olive oil with garlic. Once garlic is golden, add mushrooms and cook until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add salt midway through. Discard garlic, set mushrooms aside.
In a pan, heat remaining olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, cooking until softened, about 10 minutes without browning.
Add rice, stirring to coat, then cook until rice is translucent, about 2 minutes. Add wine, stirring until evaporated.
Add 1 cup of broth, stirring until absorbed. Repeat with another cup, then 1/2 cup, cooking until rice is nearly al dente.
Stir in mushrooms, cooking until rice is fully cooked but retains some bite, about 3-5 minutes. Add extra broth if needed.
Remove from heat, stir in Parmesan and butter. Season to taste and garnish with parsley if desired.

recipe.name: Asparagus & Crispy Cannellini Beans with Mint & Grana Padano
recipe.description: A refreshing spring salad with crispy roasted cannellini beans, blanched asparagus, fresh mint, and shavings of Grana Padano or Parmigiano-Reggiano.
steps: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Pat beans dry, then spread on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 3 tbsp olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and roast for 20 minutes or until crisp.
Blanch asparagus in salted boiling water for 1 minute, then transfer to an ice bath. Slice into 2-inch pieces.
In a large bowl, combine arugula, asparagus, cheese, mint, and beans. Drizzle with remaining olive oil and toss gently.
Serve on a platter, scatter anchovies if using, and sprinkle with flaky sea salt.

recipe.name: Best Tuna Salad
recipe.description: A classic tuna salad made with solid white albacore tuna, creamy mayonnaise, lemon juice, and a dash of fish sauce for extra umami. Perfect for sandwiches or as a dip.

ingredients.ingredient_name: solid white albacore tuna in oil, drained

steps: In a large mixing bowl, add all ingredients and stir until the mayonnaise is fully incorporated.
Taste and adjust with more salt, lemon juice, or mustard as needed.
Serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to 3 days. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.

recipe.name: Cajun Chicken & Rice
recipe.description: A flavorful one-pot Cajun chicken and rice dish featuring a homemade spice blend, cooked with chicken thighs, bell peppers, onions, and celery for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

steps: In a small bowl, mix paprika, salt, oregano, thyme, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and red pepper flakes to make the Cajun seasoning.
In another bowl, combine 1 tbsp of Cajun seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil to make a paste. Rub the paste onto the chicken thighs.
In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the remaining oil. Sear chicken, skin-side down, until golden, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, saut√© onion, bell pepper, and celery with butter, seasoning with salt and pepper. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Stir in 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning, then add broth and rice. Bring to a simmer, place chicken on top, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes until rice is tender.
Fluff rice with a fork, garnish with parsley and scallions, and serve.

recipe.name: Brothy Tomato Pasta with White Fish, Shallots & Capers
recipe.description: A light, brothy pasta with cherry tomatoes, white fish, and a crispy caper topping. Perfect for a fresh, seaside-inspired meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colatura di alici or fish sauce (optional)
mezzi paccheri or other tubular pasta
skinless white fish (e.g., Pollock), cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: For the topping, heat ¬º cup of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, cooking until browned, about 5 minutes. Add capers, cook 1 minute, then stir in 1 tbsp parsley and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
In a large saut√© pan over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper, cooking until softened, 8-10 minutes.
Add tomato paste, cooking 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, if using, and reduce by half, 3-5 minutes. Add 2 cups of water, simmer for 10 minutes, then add fish sauce to taste.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente.
Season fish with salt and pepper, add to the broth, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes, flipping once.
Add pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the broth and breaking up the fish into flakes. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.
Serve pasta with caper topping, remaining parsley, and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Spice-Crusted Pork Tenderloin With Caramelized Masala Cabbage
recipe.description: A flavorful pork tenderloin crusted with spices and served with caramelized cabbage cooked in garam masala and apple cider vinegar.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Crush coriander, cumin, fennel, and peppercorns to a coarse powder, then mix with garlic powder, thyme, paprika, and salt.
Rub pork with mustard and coat with spice blend. Heat oil in an oven-safe skillet, sear pork on all sides for 5 minutes, then bake for 20 minutes. Rest under foil for 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add mustard and caraway seeds until they pop. Add cabbage and onion, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes.
Add apple, garam masala, brown sugar, vinegar, and salt. Cook for an additional 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve sliced pork on or alongside cabbage, garnished with cilantro.

recipe.name: Pomegranate-Braised Pot Roast
recipe.description: A tender, flavorful pot roast braised in a savory and slightly sweet broth with pomegranate molasses, red wine, and classic aromatics. Perfect for festive gatherings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: medium carrots, peeled and roughly chopped
rice pilaf, couscous, or mashed potatoes (for serving)

steps: Pat the chuck roast dry and season all over with salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Sear the chuck roast on all sides until golden-brown, about 4-5 minutes per side. Set aside and reduce heat to medium.

Pour off excess fat, leaving about 2 tablespoons in the pot. Add onions, carrots, and celery, cooking until softened, about 6-7 minutes. Add garlic and tomato paste, cooking for an additional 2 minutes.
Add stock, red wine, onion soup mix, and pomegranate molasses. Bring to a simmer, then return the roast to the pot.
Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 3-4 hours, checking periodically, until meat is tender and easily shredded.
Remove the roast from the pot and let rest on a cutting board. Shred into large pieces and transfer to a serving platter, spooning the sauce over top.
Serve with rice pilaf, couscous, or mashed potatoes, garnished with pomegranate arils if desired.

recipe.name: Shrimp Tacos with Charred Corn & Peach Salsa
recipe.description: Grilled shrimp tacos topped with a fresh, summery salsa of charred corn, peach, avocado, and a tangy lime crema. Perfect for a light and flavorful meal.
steps: Char the corn over a medium flame until evenly charred, about 4-5 minutes. Remove kernels and place in a bowl.
Combine corn with peach, onion, cucumber, jalape√±o, avocado, cilantro, lime juice, and olive oil. Season with salt.
In another bowl, marinate shrimp with lime zest, juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper for 10 minutes.
Char tortillas over an open flame or on a grill, about 30 seconds per side. Wrap to keep warm.
Heat a grill pan and cook shrimp until charred and cooked through, about 1 minute per side.
Mix sour cream with lime juice, salt, and pepper. Thin with water if needed for drizzling consistency.
Assemble tacos with shrimp, corn-peach salsa, and lime crema, serving with extra lime wedges.

recipe.name: Autumn Salad with Horseradish Vinaigrette
recipe.description: A warm autumn salad with roasted Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, butternut squash, white beans, and pomegranate seeds, tossed in a tangy horseradish vinaigrette.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Place Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, and butternut squash on a baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil, balsamic, salt, pepper, nutmeg, and cayenne. Toss to coat.
Roast in the upper third of the oven for 35 minutes, until edges are browned.
For the vinaigrette, blend horseradish, garlic, shallot, honey, white wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper until smooth. Adjust seasoning to taste.
When the roasted vegetables are done, add the white beans to the hot tray and toss together. Let cool to room temperature.
Add pomegranate seeds, arugula, and a generous drizzle of vinaigrette. Toss to coat and serve.

recipe.name: Parmesan-Crusted Chicken With Herby Potatoes
recipe.description: Golden, crispy Parmesan-crusted chicken cutlets served with a warm potato salad tossed in a herby vinaigrette, perfect for a cozy dinner.
steps: In a pot, cover potatoes with water and a generous pinch of salt. Bring to a boil and cook until fork-tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and cool.
Combine potatoes, onion, parsley, and dill in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, pepper, mustard, and salt for dressing. Toss with potatoes.
Slice each chicken breast in half horizontally, creating four thin cutlets. Pound each cutlet to 1/4-inch thickness.
In separate shallow bowls, place flour (mixed with salt and paprika), beaten eggs, and a mixture of panko and Parmesan.
Dredge chicken in flour, dip in eggs, and coat in breadcrumb mixture. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook each cutlet until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to serving plates.
Top each cutlet with potato salad, garnish with flaky salt, and serve with lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Italian-Style Meatballs With Impossible‚Ñ¢ Burger
recipe.description: Juicy, flavorful plant-based meatballs made with Impossible‚Ñ¢ Burger, Parmesan, fennel, and Calabrian chile paste. Perfect for serving with marinara sauce or in a sandwich.
steps: In a large bowl, combine the panko and milk, letting it sit for 5 minutes to absorb. Add Parmesan, egg, garlic, parsley, salt, chile paste, and fennel. Mix well.
Add the Impossible Burger, mixing until fully combined. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Drizzle a sheet pan with 1 tbsp olive oil. With oiled hands, divide the mixture into 14 portions and roll each into a ball.
Heat remaining olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs for 1-1.5 minutes per side until browned.
Serve hot or add to marinara sauce and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with pasta or in a sandwich.

recipe.name: Spicy Watermelon with Tomatoes, Prosciutto & Salted-Lime Yogurt
recipe.description: A refreshing summer salad with watermelon, tomatoes, prosciutto, and salted-lime yogurt, topped with spicy chile crisp for a burst of flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chile crisp or favorite chile sauce

steps: Combine watermelon, tomatoes, and cucumber in a bowl with sea salt, 2 tsp olive oil, and 2 tsp lime juice. Toss gently and set aside.
In a small bowl, make salted-lime yogurt by mixing yogurt with 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tsp olive oil, and flaky salt.
In another small bowl, mix chile crisp with remaining lime juice.
On a large platter, spread a layer of yogurt, then top with watermelon mixture. Arrange prosciutto, basil or mint, and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Drizzle chile crisp over and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Bang Bang Crispy Chicken
recipe.description: A Sichuan-inspired crispy chicken dish with a spicy, tangy sauce made with homemade chile oil, perfect for pairing with rice, noodles, or lettuce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Chinese black vinegar or red wine vinegar
steamed rice, noodles, or shredded lettuce

steps: Preheat oven to 450¬∞F. Rub chicken with sesame oil, salt, and white pepper. Loosen the skin from the meat slightly. Place on a sheet pan, skin-side up, and roast for 30-35 minutes until skin is crispy.
For the sauce, mix chile oil, sesame paste, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and ginger in a bowl.
When chicken is done, press each piece with a rolling pin to shred the meat slightly. Add any pan drippings to the sauce.
Serve the chicken over rice, noodles, or lettuce, topped with cucumber, peanuts, scallions, and cilantro. Drizzle sauce over.

recipe.name: Polish Dill Pickle Soup (Zupa Og√≥rkowa)
recipe.description: A tangy and creamy Polish soup with dill pickles, potatoes, and a touch of horseradish, capturing the flavors of spring and the richness of a hearty soup.

ingredients.ingredient_name: sour cream, plus more for garnish

steps: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Saut√© the onion for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add carrots, celery, leek, horseradish, and garlic, seasoning with salt and pepper. Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring, until vegetables are slightly softened.
Pour in the stock, bring to a boil, then add potatoes and pickles. Reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until potatoes are tender.
In a bowl, whisk together sour cream, flour, and 1 cup of warm broth from the pot to prevent curdling.
Transfer half of the soup's vegetables and 1 cup of broth to a blender, blend until smooth, and return to the pot. Stir in the sour cream mixture and pickle brine.
Serve warm, garnished with dill and extra sour cream if desired.

recipe.name: Korean Rice Cake "Lasagna"
recipe.description: A unique lasagna featuring chewy Korean rice cakes layered with spicy gochujang sauce, creamy b√©chamel, and savory pork, topped with melted cheese and chili-garlic oil.
steps: Mix ground pork with cornstarch. Heat sesame and olive oil in a pot over medium-high, cook pork until browned. Blend apple, garlic, shallot, soy sauce, fish sauce, black pepper, and Sichuan pepper into a smooth paste. Add to pork and cook until deeply caramelized. Set aside.
Mix gochujang, yogurt, milk, maple syrup, and Dijon mustard until smooth. Set aside.

Blend garlic chives with milk and heavy cream until smooth. In a pot, cook butter and flour over medium heat until foamy. Remove from heat, whisk in chive mixture, return to heat, add fish sauce and nutmeg, and cook until thickened. Set aside.
Combine chile flakes, grated garlic, and sesame oil in a bowl.

Assemble in a baking dish, layering gochujang sauce, rice cakes, pork mixture, green b√©chamel, and cheese. Repeat until all ingredients are used. Top with cheese and spoon gochugaru oil over. Cover with foil.
Bake at 355¬∞F for 1 hour, then let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Turkey & Mushroom Burgers
recipe.description: A healthier twist on classic burgers with ground turkey, caramelized mushrooms, and onions for added flavor. Great with Swiss cheese and a pretzel bun.
steps: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Saut√© the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms, stir, and continue to saut√© for about 20 minutes until softened. Cool completely.
In a bowl, mix the mushroom-onion mixture, ground turkey, egg, and salt. Form into four patties.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet over high heat, add canola oil, and sear patties for 3 minutes per side, until browned. Top with cheese, if desired.
Serve on a bun with your favorite toppings.

recipe.name: Indian Rice Pilaf with Tomato-Onion Raita & Crispy Papad
recipe.description: A fragrant Indian rice pilaf with spices, vegetables, and golden raisins, served with a cooling tomato-onion raita and crispy papad.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Indian-style yogurt or plain whole-milk yogurt

steps: For the raita: Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan over medium heat. Saut√© the onion and tomato for 2-3 minutes with a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl to cool.
Add the cooled onion-tomato mixture to yogurt, garnish with cilantro, and set aside.
In a small pan, heat the remaining oil, add green chile and mustard seeds, cooking until seeds pop. Pour over the yogurt mixture.
For the pilaf: Rinse the rice and cook with a 1:2 ratio of rice to water until fluffy.
In a large pan, heat 2 tbsp ghee, adding cardamom, cinnamon, clove, bay leaves, star anise, and cumin seeds. Saut√© for 2-3 minutes.
Add onions, cooking until translucent, then add ginger, garlic, and chile. Cook for 3-5 minutes until fragrant.
Add carrots, peas, and green beans, cooking until just tender. Add salt and mint.
Combine the cooked rice with the vegetable mixture.
In a separate pan, heat remaining ghee, toasting cashews and raisins until golden. Stir into the rice and garnish with cilantro.
Serve with papad and raita.

recipe.name: Crunchy-Shell Cauliflower Tacos
recipe.description: Inspired by classic ground-beef tacos, these vegetarian tacos feature roasted cauliflower in crispy shells, with toppings like shredded lettuce and pepper jack cheese.
steps: Preheat the oven to 450¬∞F and line two sheet pans with silicone mats or parchment paper.
Remove the bottom of the cauliflower stem and leaves, then roughly chop. Process in two batches until almost riced, with a few chunks remaining.
Spread cauliflower evenly on both sheet pans. Toss with olive oil, chili powder, and salt, then spread out for even roasting.
Roast for about 20 minutes, rotating pans halfway through for even browning.
While the cauliflower roasts, warm the taco shells in the oven until crisp, about 2 minutes.
Assemble tacos by layering cauliflower, lettuce, and cheese in each shell.

recipe.name: Kung Pao Tofu
recipe.description: A Sichuan-inspired Kung Pao Tofu with crispy tofu, a spicy, tangy sauce, and toasted peanuts. Perfect served with rice for a flavorful vegetarian meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: scallions, white and green parts separated

steps: In a small bowl, whisk 2 tablespoons of water with soy sauces, vinegar, sugar, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and salt until combined.
Cut tofu into cubes and toss with 3 tablespoons of cornstarch until coated.
Heat oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat. Fry tofu until golden brown on all sides, 1-3 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, saut√© ginger for 2-3 minutes. Add chiles, garlic, and white parts of scallions, cooking until fragrant.
Return tofu to the pan, pour in the sauce, and add Sichuan peppercorns if using. Toss to coat, then fold in green parts of scallions and peanuts.
Serve hot with rice.

recipe.name: Mandilli de Sea With Sugo Finto & Parmesan Crisps
recipe.description: A luxurious pasta dish with delicate handkerchief pasta (mandilli de sea) served with a savory vegetarian 'meat' sauce (sugo finto) and crisp Parmesan.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fennel bulb or large carrot, finely chopped

steps: In a saucepan, melt half the butter over medium heat and add the meat substitute. Cook, stirring, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
In the same pan, melt remaining butter, add chopped vegetables with a pinch of salt, and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook briefly. Stir in tomato and miso pastes, cooking until tomato paste darkens, about 2 minutes. Return meat to pan.
Add red wine and Worcestershire sauce, simmer for 1-2 minutes. Add vegetable stock, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add milk, stir, and continue simmering for 45 minutes. Season to taste.
For the pasta, mix flours and eggs until smooth, knead, then rest for 30 minutes. Roll thin, cut into large squares.
For Parmesan crisps, bake grated cheese in a thin layer at 400¬∞F for 5-7 minutes until golden.
Serve pasta with sauce and Parmesan crisps.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Couscous With Spring Vegetables
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful couscous dish with nutty brown butter, sumac, and vibrant spring vegetables. Perfect as a side or light main.
steps: To make brown-butter couscous: In a saucepan, melt 3 tbsp butter over medium heat until browned and nutty. Add couscous, 1 tsp sumac, and salt. Stir, then add 1 1/4 cups water, bring to a boil, add peas, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes.
For pearl couscous: Brown butter as above, then toast couscous in the butter for 3 minutes. Add water per package instructions, sumac, and salt. Add peas in the last 5 minutes. Fluff when done.

For vegetables: Slice two radishes thinly for garnish. Quarter remaining radishes and saut√© in butter with sumac, salt, and pepper until caramelized. Add almonds and currants to the pan, toast, then wilt in spinach or arugula.
Combine couscous with vegetables, season with lemon juice, and top with feta and reserved radish slices.

recipe.name: Cold Soba With Perilla Oil Dressing
recipe.description: A quick, refreshing Korean-inspired soba noodle dish with a nutty perilla oil dressing, topped with sesame seeds and seaweed. Perfect for hot days or as a light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: roasted dried seaweed (Korean gim or Japanese nori)

steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the soba noodles.
In a large bowl, mix perilla oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Set aside.
In a mortar and pestle, coarsely grind the sesame seeds. Crush the seaweed sheet by hand or with a plastic bag and set aside.
Cook soba noodles for exactly 4 minutes. Rinse in cold water several times to remove starch, then drain well.
Add the noodles to the bowl with the dressing and toss to coat.
Plate the noodles, topping with crushed sesame seeds and seaweed. Garnish with cucumber and shredded chicken, if using. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegan Pasta al Limone(ish)
recipe.description: A creamy, tangy pasta made with a cashew-based sauce, lemon juice, and nutritional yeast, perfect for a light and flavorful vegan meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: raw cashews, soaked in hot water
flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest

steps: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.

In a blender, combine soaked cashews, lemon peel and juice, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Blend until smooth, adding more water to achieve desired consistency.
Return pasta to pot, add sauce, and toss to coat. Thin with additional pasta water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest on top.

recipe.name: Pork 'Almost' Sisig
recipe.description: A Filipino-American adaptation of classic sisig, featuring roasted pork belly, aromatics, and tangy sauce. Served with crispy pork skin and eggs.

ingredients.ingredient_name: steamed rice or garlic fried rice

steps: Season pork belly generously with salt, place skin side up on a rack in a baking sheet, and refrigerate uncovered for 8-48 hours.
Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Rub pork skin with oil and salt, roast with water in the baking tray for 1.75-2 hours until golden brown, then increase temperature to 450¬∞F for 15 minutes to crisp.
Cool for 20 minutes, remove crispy skin, chop pork into ¬º-inch pieces.
In a skillet, heat oil, then add pork and cook until edges crisp. Add onion, garlic, ginger, scallion whites, and chile, cooking until softened.
Mix fish sauce, lemon juice, vinegar, and soy sauce in a bowl. Add to the pan, cooking until liquid evaporates. Make 4 spaces, add eggs, bake until done.
Top with chopped pork skin, scallion greens, and chiles. Serve with lime and rice.

recipe.name: BLT Salad
recipe.description: A fresh twist on the classic BLT sandwich, featuring crispy bacon, toasted sourdough croutons, butterhead lettuce, and a tangy tomato-mayo dressing.
steps: Cut crusts off bread and tear into pieces. Add bacon to a skillet over medium heat, cook until crispy, and transfer to a plate, reserving the fat.
In the same skillet, add bread pieces to bacon fat, season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden and crispy. Let cool.
Tear lettuce leaves into bite-sized pieces, wash, and dry well.
Blend half the tomatoes with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings.
Cut remaining tomatoes in half, and break up bacon into pieces.
In a large bowl, toss lettuce, croutons, bacon, and dressing. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Garlic-Studded Pork Shoulder With Anchovies & Calabrian Chiles
recipe.description: A savory braised pork shoulder infused with garlic, anchovies, and Calabrian chiles, served with crunchy gremolata bread crumbs.
steps: With a paring knife, poke 20 deep holes in the pork. Place a garlic half in each hole and sprinkle evenly with salt.
In a Dutch oven, heat 3 tbsp oil over medium-high heat. Sear the pork until all sides are golden brown, about 6-8 minutes per side. Remove from pot.
Add remaining oil and sliced onion to the pot, stirring to loosen browned bits. Cook until the onions are light brown and wilted, about 5 minutes.
Add chiles, anchovies, and garlic, cooking until anchovies dissolve. Add white wine and parsley, simmer until mostly reduced, about 8-10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Add 2 cups water, black pepper, and fennel seeds to the pot. Return pork to the pot, skin side up if applicable. Cover and braise in the oven for 3-4 hours.
For the gremolata bread crumbs: In a skillet, cook panko with olive oil until golden brown. Add parsley, lemon zest, garlic, and salt, stirring until combined. Set aside.
Serve pork with gremolata bread crumbs, fresh parsley, and your choice of sides.

recipe.name: Baked Salmon With Brown-Buttered Tomatoes & Basil
recipe.description: A delicious, simple baked salmon with brown butter, fragrant mustard seeds, and roasted cherry tomatoes, finished with fresh basil.

ingredients.ingredient_name: salmon fillet, skin on or off

steps: Preheat oven to 325¬∞F. Place salmon skin-side down on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.

In a medium saucepan, melt butter with mustard seeds over medium heat, swirling until butter is browned and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes. Add vinegar, red pepper flakes, and cherry tomatoes, and cook for 2-3 minutes until tomatoes start to burst.
Pour the tomato mixture over the salmon, spreading butter and seeds evenly. Bake for 15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily.
Let the salmon rest briefly, top with fresh basil, and season with flaky salt. Serve with crusty bread, pasta, or rice.

recipe.name: Tacos Gobernador
recipe.description: A delicious shrimp taco recipe from Sinaloa, featuring buttery shrimp, melted cheese, and a mix of saut√©ed vegetables in a toasted flour tortilla.

ingredients.ingredient_name: queso asadero or Monterey Jack cheese, grated

steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Cook shrimp in an even layer until just starting to brown, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a bowl.
Reduce heat to medium, add butter, and saut√© onion, poblano, celery, serrano, garlic, oregano, salt, and coriander until softened, about 6-8 minutes.
Add tomato and cook until it begins to break down, about 5 minutes. Transfer to the bowl with shrimp and toss to combine.
Wipe skillet and heat tortillas until lightly toasted on one side. Flip, add cheese, shrimp filling, and fold.
Cook until cheese melts, then serve with lime wedges and salsa.

recipe.name: Stovetop Mac & Cheese With Garlic Powder & White Pepper
recipe.description: A quick and creamy stovetop mac and cheese inspired by classic flavors, featuring garlic powder and white pepper for extra depth.

ingredients.ingredient_unit: for pasta water and to taste

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente, checking after 4 minutes. Drain.
Return pot to medium heat, add cream, and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Reduce heat to low, add cheese, garlic powder, and white pepper. Whisk until smooth.
Stir pasta into sauce, adjusting seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Chou Farci (Stuffed Cabbage)
recipe.description: A classic French dish of stuffed cabbage with layers of ground meat, mushrooms, and vegetables, wrapped in cabbage leaves for an elegant presentation.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ground lamb, beef, veal, or pork

steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Core cabbage and separate 16-18 leaves. Blanch leaves in water for 6 minutes until softened. Drain and let cool.
In a Dutch oven, melt butter and oil over medium heat. Cook the meat, stirring, until browned, about 5-6 minutes.
Add mushrooms, onion, carrots, garlic, and thyme. Cook for 8-10 minutes until softened. Stir in tomato paste, allspice, and nutmeg, cooking for 2 minutes.
Pour in stock, scrape the pan, and simmer until some liquid absorbs, about 5 minutes. Let cool slightly, then mix with egg, breadcrumbs, and parsley.
Butter a springform pan and line with cabbage leaves, shingling them to cover the sides and base. Layer one-third of filling and cover with cabbage leaves, repeating layers until filled.
Bake at 350¬∞F for 40 minutes until cabbage browns slightly. Let cool 10 minutes, unmold, and serve in slices.

recipe.name: Ethereal Egg Biryani
recipe.description: A fragrant and flavorful egg biryani featuring layers of spiced rice, eggs, and a richly seasoned yogurt-based sauce, inspired by traditional South Asian biryanis.

ingredients.ingredient_name: serrano or hot green chile, stemmed

steps: Rinse the rice until the water is clear. Soak in salted water for 30-60 minutes, then drain.
Steam the eggs for 8 minutes, cool in an ice bath, and peel. Set aside.
Cook the rice in boiling water for 6 minutes, then drain and cool.
Blend garlic, ginger, chile, shallots, yogurt, mint, fennel, paprika, coriander, garam masala, salt, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne into a smooth paste.
In a large pot, heat ghee, then saut√© onions until golden brown. Add tomato paste and spice paste, cooking until fragrant and thickened.
Add water to the sauce, then layer in eggs and top with rice, cilantro, lime juice, and more ghee. Cover and cook on low heat for 6-8 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.
Gently stir before serving hot.

recipe.name: Peach & Tomato Salad With Fish Sauce Vinaigrette
recipe.description: A vibrant summer salad featuring juicy peaches, tomatoes, and corn, all tossed in a savory, tangy fish sauce vinaigrette.

ingredients.ingredient_name: greenhouse tomatoes or heirlooms, cut into ¬Ω-inch wedges
large heirloom tomato, cut into chunks
sweet corn, kernels cut from the cob

steps: In a jar or small bowl, combine all vinaigrette ingredients and shake or whisk until emulsified. Adjust seasoning as desired.
Arrange the peaches, tomatoes, and corn on a serving plate. Pour vinaigrette over the salad, then season with black pepper and flaky salt to taste.

recipe.name: Eduardo de San Angel‚Äôs Cilantro Soup
recipe.description: A vibrant, creamy cilantro soup inspired by a beloved Mexican restaurant dish, featuring zucchini and spinach for added depth and topped with queso fresco and crema.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small jalape√±o pepper, seeded and chopped
cilantro, stems intact, plus more for garnish

steps: In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and onion, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add zucchini, yellow squash, and jalape√±o; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add spinach and cilantro, reserving a few sprigs for garnish, and cook until greens have wilted, about 3 minutes.
Pour in broth, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cumin, salt, and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes. Let soup cool slightly.
In batches, puree the soup in a blender. Strain to remove solids, then rewarm before serving.
Garnish with cilantro sprigs, queso fresco, and crema if desired.

recipe.name: Peruvian Chicken & Basil Pasta (Sopa Seca)
recipe.description: A traditional Peruvian one-pot pasta dish with a vibrant basil sauce, spiced chicken, and annatto-infused oil, perfect as a comforting main course.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces

steps: Blend basil leaves with 1 cup of chicken stock until smooth. Set aside.
Season chicken with cumin, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large pot, fry annatto seeds for about 6 minutes, then remove seeds.
Brown chicken in annatto oil, transfer to a bowl, and set aside.
In the same pot, saut√© onion until softened. Add garlic, aj√≠ panca paste (if using), carrot, and tomatoes, cooking until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the basil puree, season with salt, and bring to a simmer.
Add spaghetti and remaining chicken stock. Gently stir pasta every 30 seconds until pliable, then mix in chicken.
Cook on medium-low heat until pasta absorbs the liquid and is fully cooked, about 15-20 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Garnish with parsley and optional avocado cubes. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Paneer and Cauliflower Makhani
recipe.description: A creamy and spiced Indian curry featuring roasted cauliflower and paneer in a rich tomato-butter sauce, perfect for pairing with rice or naan.
steps: In a large blender, puree tomatoes, garlic, and chili. Work in batches if necessary.
Add cumin, turmeric, chili powder, black pepper, and honey to the tomato mixture.
In a large pot over moderate heat, bring the puree and water to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Strain the mixture into a clean pot, discarding solids. Add cream, butter, ginger, and fenugreek leaves. Season to taste.
Add roasted cauliflower to the sauce, bring to a boil, and simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in paneer cubes and cook until heated through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with basmati rice or naan.

recipe.name: Duck Breast With Blueberry-Port Sauce
recipe.description: A simple yet elegant duck breast dish, pan-seared to perfection and served with a sweet and tangy blueberry-Port sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: scallion, whites finely diced and greens cut on the diagonal

steps: Score the duck skin in a cross-hatch pattern, avoiding the flesh. Season both sides with salt.
