Place the duck breast skin-side down in a cold skillet. Cook over medium-low heat for 10-15 minutes until fat renders and skin crisps. Flip and cook 2 minutes for medium-rare (135¬∞F). Rest while making the sauce.
Pour out most of the duck fat, leaving 1 tsp in the skillet. Saut√© the white parts of the scallion for 1 minute with salt.
Add Port and blueberries, reducing until syrupy, about 10 minutes. Stir in vinegar and fish sauce, then remove from heat and whisk in butter until glossy.
Slice duck breast thinly, serve over the sauce, and garnish with scallion greens and black pepper. Pair with roasted potatoes or a side salad.

recipe.name: Gochujang Baby Back Ribs
recipe.description: Tender and flavorful baby back ribs with a Korean-inspired gochujang BBQ sauce, combining traditional Korean ingredients with American BBQ style.
steps: Preheat oven to 250¬∞F. Combine gochugaru, ground ginger, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
Remove membrane from the underside of the ribs. Season ribs with salt and pepper, then rub with the spice mixture.
Wrap ribs tightly in foil with the seam on top. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 1.5 hours.
Mix gochujang, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, sugar, minced garlic, and minced ginger in a bowl to make the sauce.
Remove ribs from the oven, open foil, and spread sauce over the ribs. Rewrap and bake for another 30 minutes.
Preheat broiler. Open foil, baste ribs with residual sauce, and broil for 5-10 minutes until charred.
Cut ribs into individual pieces and serve.

recipe.name: Haitian Legim (Legume)
recipe.description: A traditional Haitian stew made with slow-cooked vegetables and tender meat, infused with aromatic spices and served with white rice.

ingredients.ingredient_name: stew meat (beef, pork shoulder, goat, or oxtail)
scotch bonnet chili, pricked with a fork (optional)

steps: Prepare the epis: Blend scallions, parsley, garlic, scotch bonnet, green bell pepper, thyme, cloves, citrus juice, vegetable oil, salt, and bouillon cube (if using) until smooth.
Clean the meat with lime juice and salt. Rinse and drain. Scald the meat with boiling water and drain again.
Marinate the meat with epis for at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours in the refrigerator.
In a pot, sweat the meat over medium-low heat until juices are released. Add oil and cook until liquid reduces and epis separates from the oil.
Remove meat and saut√© tomato paste in the pot. Add vegetables in batches, cooking each until reduced in volume.
Return meat to the pot, add cloves, star anise, and bouillon cube. Simmer for 1 hour, then add scotch bonnet (if using) and continue cooking until tender.
Mash some of the vegetables to thicken the stew and serve with white rice.

recipe.name: Squash & Brown Butter Tortelli With Brussels Sprouts & Balsamic
recipe.description: A luxurious handmade tortelli pasta filled with creamy squash, served with nutty Brussels sprouts and a tangy balsamic reduction for a perfect autumnal dish.
steps: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F and roast the squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender, about 45 minutes.
Make brown butter by cooking butter until golden and nutty. Reserve 50g for the filling.
Reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat until thickened to a syrupy consistency. Set aside.
Prepare the pasta dough by mixing flours and eggs, knead until smooth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
Blend roasted squash with brown butter, cheeses, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until creamy. Refrigerate the filling.
Roll out pasta dough, cut into squares, and fill with squash mixture. Seal and shape tortelli.
Cook Brussels sprouts in butter until golden and slightly crispy. Set aside.
Boil tortelli, toss with reserved brown butter, and plate with Brussels sprouts and balsamic reduction.

recipe.name: Farro Salad With Torn Eggs
recipe.description: A vibrant and satisfying grain salad with toasted farro, torn eggs, dried apricots, Castelvetrano olives, radishes, arugula, and a bright vinaigrette.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dried apricots, slivered or finely chopped

steps: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add smashed garlic cloves and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes, stirring to prevent burning.
Add red pepper flakes to the saucepan and stir for 30 seconds. Then, add farro, stirring to toast the grains until they smell nutty, about 3 minutes.

Pour water into the saucepan, enough to cover the farro by about 2 inches. Add a pinch of salt, bring to a boil, and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook the farro until tender but still chewy, about 25‚Äì30 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl.
While the farro is cooking, whisk together eggs, water, lemon zest, Parmesan, and a pinch of salt and pepper in a small bowl. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook gently, without stirring, until set into a flat omelet, about 3‚Äì4 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool slightly, and tear into bite-sized pieces.
While the farro is still warm, toss it with dried apricots, red wine vinegar, and 3 tbsp olive oil. Stir to combine, allowing the farro to absorb the flavors. Let it cool slightly.
Add torn eggs, Castelvetrano olives, toasted walnuts, thinly sliced radishes, and baby arugula to the farro mixture. Toss gently to combine, adjusting seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil before serving, and add a squeeze of lemon juice for brightness if desired.

recipe.name: Creamy Green Mung Bean Soup With Warming Spices
recipe.description: A one-pot, velvety green mung bean soup with warming spices, kale, spinach, and coconut milk, inspired by Ayurvedic kitchari.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dried mung beans, soaked 10 to 12 hours in filtered water
leek, quartered and chopped (white and green parts)

steps: Drain and rinse the soaked mung beans and set aside.
Heat ghee or coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and onion, cooking for 6‚Äì8 minutes until the onion begins to brown.
Stir in garlic, ginger, leek, and cilantro stems. Cook for another few minutes until softened.
Add ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, mung beans, water, coconut milk, and kombu. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cover. Simmer for 15‚Äì20 minutes until the mung beans are tender.
Add chopped kale and sea salt. Return to a boil, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes until kale stems are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in cilantro and spinach until wilted. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Blend the soup in batches until smooth and velvety. Adjust seasoning with tamari or more salt.
Serve warm with lime wedges and optional garnishes like coconut yogurt, cilantro, or nigella seeds.

recipe.name: Toasted Farro & Antipasto Salad
recipe.description: A hearty salad that combines toasted farro, salami, artichoke hearts, Castelvetrano olives, and cherry tomatoes, finished with a tangy red wine-anchovy vinaigrette and broiled for extra flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: provolone cheese, thinly sliced or diced

steps: Cook farro in a large pot of salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
To make the vinaigrette, whisk together anchovies, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, fennel seeds, and sea salt. Gradually whisk in olive oil until emulsified.
Marinate halved cherry tomatoes with a pinch of salt, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of vinaigrette. Set aside.

Toss the warm farro with 3 tablespoons of vinaigrette in the pot. Add artichoke hearts, Castelvetrano olives, and salami, stirring to combine. Adjust seasoning with salt and red pepper flakes if needed.
Spread the farro mixture onto a baking sheet in an even layer. Broil for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the farro is toasted and salami is crispy.

Remove from oven and immediately toss in the marinated cherry tomatoes. Let cool slightly, then fold in arugula and provolone. Add additional vinaigrette if needed and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipe.name: No-Noodle Eggplant Lasagna with Mushroom Rag√∫
recipe.description: A rich and creamy lasagna featuring roasted eggplant layers, hearty mushroom rag√∫, and b√©chamel sauce. A satisfying gluten-free and meatless main dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh mushrooms, finely chopped (shiitake and cremini preferred)

steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Slice eggplants lengthwise into ¬Ω-inch slices. Sprinkle with kosher salt and let sit for 30 minutes. Pat dry with paper towels.
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and arrange on baking sheets. Roast for 25-30 minutes until lightly browned and tender. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat ¬º cup olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and carrot, cooking until softened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in garlic and tomato paste, cooking for 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, water, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until thickened.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk, stirring constantly, until thickened. Season with salt and nutmeg.
Spread a thin layer of mushroom rag√∫ in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer roasted eggplant slices, b√©chamel, and rag√∫. Repeat layers, finishing with b√©chamel and shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 375¬∞F for 40-45 minutes, until bubbling and golden. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Speedy Chicken Potato Curry
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful chicken curry with potatoes, cooked in a fragrant spice-infused sauce of tomatoes and cream, perfect for weeknight dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
russet potato, skin-on and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

steps: Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaf, letting them sizzle for a few seconds. Add cumin seeds and cook until fragrant.
Add the chopped onion and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deep golden brown. Stir in the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the canned tomatoes, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the tomatoes to soften. Stir in the salt, chile powder, turmeric, garam masala, and sugar.
Add the potato and chicken pieces to the pan along with water. Stir, cover, and cook on medium heat for 10 minutes, until the chicken and potatoes are tender.
Stir in the cream and chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

recipe.name: Pisto Manchego With Eggs
recipe.description: A Spanish vegetable stew similar to ratatouille, made with tomatoes, peppers, onions, and zucchini, topped with fried eggs for a hearty meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: zucchini or yellow squash, peeled and chopped
Italian peppers or bell peppers, cored and chopped

steps: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add olive oil. Once hot, add onions and a pinch of salt, stirring continuously until golden.
Add zucchini and a splash more olive oil. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and cook until softened.
Stir in peppers and more olive oil if needed. Cook for a few minutes, then add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, stirring to release their moisture. Cook until tomatoes break down. Add sherry vinegar (if using), water, and let simmer for at least 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and fry eggs to your preferred doneness.
Serve the pisto warm, topped with a fried egg for each portion. Pair with crusty bread or baguette.

recipe.name: Beet & Chickpea Cakes With Tzatziki
recipe.description: Savory, earthy cakes made with chickpeas and beets, baked to perfection and served with a refreshing, garlicky tzatziki sauce. Perfect as a main or tucked into warm pita with fresh veggies.

ingredients.ingredient_name: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
cooked chickpeas (or two 15-ounce cans, drained and rinsed)

steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and lightly brush with olive oil.
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and crush with a potato masher, leaving the mixture slightly chunky.
Warm 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saut√© for 5 minutes until beginning to brown. Add garlic and salt, cooking for another 3‚Äì4 minutes.
Stir in grated beets and cook for 6‚Äì8 minutes until softened. Add balsamic vinegar, mix well, and remove from heat.
Combine the mashed chickpeas, onion-beet mixture, and chopped dill. Season with additional salt and black pepper as needed.
Use an oiled ‚Öì-cup measure to shape the mixture into cakes. Place on the prepared sheet pan and brush the tops and sides with olive oil.
Bake for 15 minutes. Rotate the tray and bake for another 10‚Äì15 minutes until browned on the bottom.
Let cakes cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with tzatziki.

recipe.name: Beetroot Risotto With Goat Cheese
recipe.description: A luxurious and vibrant risotto featuring earthy roasted beets, creamy goat cheese, and a splash of ros√© wine for a hint of brightness.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Toss the chopped beets with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a sheet pan until tender, about 25‚Äì30 minutes. Let cool slightly.
In a small saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer and keep warm over low heat.
In a large, wide-bottomed pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced shallots and saut√© until translucent, about 2 minutes.
Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat the grains in butter. Pour in the ros√© wine, stirring constantly until it reduces and the alcohol evaporates.

Lower the heat and ladle in the warm stock, one or two ladlefuls at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue until the rice is al dente, about 18‚Äì20 minutes.
Meanwhile, puree the roasted beets with sour cream in a blender until smooth.
When the risotto is cooked to your liking, stir in the beet-sour cream puree. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chunks of goat cheese and chopped chives.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Chili Con Carne
recipe.description: A deeply flavorful beef chili made with achiote paste, jalape√±os, and kidney beans, cooked to tender perfection in an Instant Pot.

ingredients.ingredient_name: minced shallots, plus more for topping
lime juice, plus more to taste
dried kidney beans, soaked 4 hours, then rinsed

steps: Season beef cubes with salt and pepper. Turn Instant Pot to saut√© mode and heat 1 tbsp butter until foaming. Brown half the beef, then remove with a slotted spoon. Repeat with remaining butter and beef.
Add shallots, jalape√±os, and 2 tsp kosher salt to the Instant Pot. Saut√© until shallots are translucent, about 3 minutes.
Make a well in the center and add achiote paste and tomato paste. Saut√© for 1 minute, breaking up the paste. Add water to deglaze, scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, lime juice, brown sugar, kidney beans, and browned beef. Mix well.
Set the Instant Pot to pressure cook on high for 35 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally for at least 5 minutes, then quick-release.
Shred the beef with two forks. Adjust seasoning with additional lime juice or salt if needed. Serve with desired toppings like grated cheese, sour cream, or chopped green onions.

recipe.name: Pork Ribs in Chile Verde (Costillas de Puerco en Salsa Verde)
recipe.description: A classic Mexican dish featuring tender pork ribs simmered in a tangy and flavorful green tomatillo and poblano sauce, perfect with warm tortillas and beans.

ingredients.ingredient_name: rendered lard or extra-virgin olive oil
pork spareribs, baby back ribs, neck bones, or shoulder, cut into 2-inch pieces
poblano chiles, stemmed, seeded, and chopped
jalape√±os, stemmed and seeded if desired
cilantro leaves and tender stems, roughly chopped

steps: In a spice grinder, grind bay leaves, cumin, coriander, oregano, and peppercorns until very finely ground. Set aside.
Heat lard or oil in a large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Brown ribs in batches, turning once, until browned on at least 2 sides, 5‚Äì7 minutes per batch. Transfer to a large bowl.
To the same pot, add onion and salt, cooking until browned and tender, about 8‚Äì10 minutes. Stir occasionally, scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
Add the spice blend and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add poblanos, tomatillos, jalape√±os, and garlic, stirring occasionally, until tender and just starting to brown, about 8‚Äì10 minutes.
Return the ribs to the pot and add 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the ribs are tender and falling off the bone, 2‚Äì2 ¬Ω hours.
Let sit covered for 15 minutes. Stir in scallions and cilantro before serving. Serve with warm tortillas and frijoles de olla.

recipe.name: Caramelized Kimchi Patty Melt
recipe.description: A bold twist on the classic patty melt featuring spicy caramelized kimchi, juicy beef patties, and Pepper Jack cheese, all sandwiched between perfectly toasted rye bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ripe kimchi, drained and roughly chopped

steps: In a small skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add chopped kimchi and sugar, cooking for 4-5 minutes until the liquid evaporates and the kimchi is caramelized. Set aside.

In a large bowl, mix ground beef with Worcestershire sauce until combined. Divide into 4 portions, shape into oblong patties (matching the size of the bread), and flatten. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tsp oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties in batches for 1-2 minutes per side, until browned but still juicy. Remove from skillet.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice. Place 2 slices in the skillet, mayo-side down. Add a slice of cheese, a beef patty, a portion of caramelized kimchi, another slice of cheese, and a second slice of bread (mayo-side up).

Cook over medium-low heat, pressing gently with a spatula or burger press, for 1-2 minutes until the bread is toasted and the cheese starts to melt. Sprinkle with garlic salt on the top slice if desired. Flip and repeat on the other side.
Cut sandwiches in half diagonally and serve immediately, optionally with a cold dill pickle.

recipe.name: Green Rice With Jammy Eggs
recipe.description: A vibrant dish featuring crispy green rice infused with herbs and jalape√±o, paired with jammy eggs, charred kale, and a hint of lime for a wholesome, flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large bunch cilantro or parsley (or a mixture)
jalape√±o, halved, seeds removed if desired
large bunch kale, chard, or other leafy greens
roasted salted peanuts or cashews, roughly chopped (optional)

steps: Roughly chop the cilantro, parsley, and scallions. Add to a food processor with jalape√±o and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped but not a paste. Reserve 2 tablespoons of this mixture.
Combine the remaining herb mixture with cooked rice, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Toss to combine and set aside.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Gently lower eggs into the pot and boil for 6‚Äì8 minutes for jammy yolks. Transfer eggs to ice water, then peel and halve.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add half the kale, season with salt and pepper, and cook until charred, about 5 minutes. Add remaining kale and cook until wilted. Remove and set aside.

Heat remaining olive oil in the same skillet. Add the rice mixture, pressing firmly with a spatula. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes until crisp on the bottom, then toss and cook for another 4‚Äì6 minutes.
Mix the rice with charred kale, lime zest, and juice. Toss in the reserved herb mixture. Top with halved eggs, nuts (if using), and serve with lime wedges.

recipe.name: Vegan Carnitas Tacos With Guajillo Jam
recipe.description: A vibrant vegan take on carnitas tacos, featuring crispy chickpeas, savory mushrooms, and a sweet-spicy guajillo jam, served with charred tortillas and fresh toppings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: mixed mushrooms, torn into bite-sized pieces
scallions or spring onions, thinly sliced
lime wedges, avocado slices, parsley, and shredded red cabbage
chiles cascabel or de √°rbol, stemmed and seeded

steps: Heat 6 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Fry chickpeas for 15‚Äì20 minutes until golden and crispy. Transfer to a bowl lined with paper towels, season with salt and pepper, and set aside.

In the same skillet, reduce heat to medium-high. Cook half the mushrooms undisturbed until browned, about 3‚Äì4 minutes. Toss and cook until tender. Transfer to the bowl with chickpeas. Repeat with more oil and the remaining mushrooms.
Add 1 tablespoon oil to the skillet, cook the white parts of scallions and garlic until just beginning to brown. Combine with the chickpeas and mushrooms.
To make the guajillo jam, blend guajillo chiles, cascabel chiles, onion, garlic, vinegar, orange juice, sugar, salt, peppercorns, oregano, and cloves until smooth.
Transfer the chile puree to a saucepan with 1 cup of water. Cook over medium-low heat until thick and syrupy, about 50‚Äì60 minutes. Add orange zest and let cool.
Serve carnitas on tortillas with jam, lime wedges, avocado slices, parsley, and red cabbage.

recipe.name: Corn, Shrimp & Avocado Salad With Chipotle-Pepita Dressing
recipe.description: A no-cook, Tex-Mex inspired salad with fresh romaine, corn, creamy avocado, and shrimp, topped with cotija cheese and a smoky chipotle-pepita dressing.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large head romaine (or 2 romaine hearts), trimmed
cotija, queso fresco, or feta, crumbled
extra-virgin olive oil or sunflower oil
full-fat sour cream or Greek yogurt

steps: Combine all dressing ingredients in a mini food processor or blender. Process until smooth. Taste and adjust salt, acidity, and spice as needed.
Toss shrimp in 2 tablespoons of the dressing. Season with a pinch of salt.
Arrange half the romaine on a serving platter. Drizzle some dressing over the leaves and scatter corn, avocado, cotija, and shrimp on top. Season lightly with salt.
Repeat with the remaining romaine, dressing, and toppings. Sprinkle pepitas over the salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side for individual preferences.

recipe.name: Grilled Shrimp With Romesco Sauce
recipe.description: A simple and flavor-packed dinner featuring smoky, tender grilled shrimp coated in a tangy, nutty romesco sauce made from pantry ingredients. Perfect with bread, rice, or vegetables.

ingredients.ingredient_name: roasted piquillo or red bell peppers
sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil
olive oil from the jar of sun-dried tomatoes
large or jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails on
olive or neutral oil for grilling

steps: In a food processor, pulse almonds until finely ground. Add roasted peppers, olive oil, sun-dried tomatoes, reserved oil, water, sherry vinegar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes. Blend until smooth. Adjust salt, pepper, and vinegar to taste. Reserve 2/3 cup for shrimp marinade.
Pat shrimp dry and toss in a bowl with 2/3 cup romesco sauce and kosher salt. Let marinate for up to 12 hours or grill immediately.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Clean and oil the grates.
Grill shrimp for 2‚Äì3 minutes on the first side until slightly charred. Flip and grill another 1‚Äì2 minutes until opaque and cooked through. Remove from grill.
Squeeze lemon juice over the shrimp and serve with remaining romesco sauce.

recipe.name: Islander Lively Bowl With Pineapple Salsa
recipe.description: A vibrant grain bowl with smoky mushrooms, sweet pineapple salsa, creamy cilantro aioli, and fresh toppings, inspired by Caribbean flavors.
steps: In a medium bowl, mix pineapple, cilantro, red onion, tomatoes, jalape√±o, and lime juice. Season with salt and black pepper. Cover and refrigerate.
In a large bowl, whisk tamari, sesame oil, maple syrup, and sriracha. Add shiitake mushrooms, tossing to coat. Marinate for at least 20 minutes.
Blend vegan mayo, olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, lime zest, cumin, salt, and black pepper until smooth. Refrigerate until serving.
Drain mushrooms and heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes per side.
Assemble bowls with brown rice, mushrooms, pineapple salsa, and a dollop of aioli. Garnish with avocado slices and pickled red onions, if desired.

recipe.name: Fried Eggs With Ginger-Garlic Crisp & Creamed Greens
recipe.description: A comforting dish featuring creamy, blended kale topped with perfectly fried eggs and crispy, aromatic ginger-garlic, perfect for breakfast, brunch, or a light dinner.

ingredients.ingredient_name: serrano or other hot chile, roughly chopped
fresh ginger, cut into thin strips

steps: In a skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add onion, garlic, and serrano. Cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes.
Add frozen kale, water, and 1/4 tsp salt. Cover and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until kale is tender and thawed, about 10 minutes.
Transfer the kale mixture to a food processor. Add cream cheese, lemon zest, and juice. Blend until mostly smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Add milk if too thick.
For the ginger-garlic crisp: Add ginger and garlic to a cold skillet with oil. Cook over low heat, swirling occasionally, until golden brown. Strain over a bowl and reserve the oil.
Using the same skillet, heat it over medium-high. Add sesame seeds where the eggs will land. Crack eggs over the seeds, season with salt, and fry to desired doneness.
Divide creamed greens into 4 bowls. Top with eggs, ginger-garlic crisp, scallions, and hot sauce. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Welsh Cawl
recipe.description: A hearty lamb and root vegetable stew, a traditional Welsh dish served with bread and cheese, perfect for cold days.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless lamb shoulder or stew meat
large white or yellow onion, diced
diced soup greens or 1 small carrot and parsley
Russet potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/2-inch thick
celeriac bulb, peeled and diced (or celery stalks, sliced 1/2-inch thick)
large leeks (white and green parts), washed and sliced 1/2-inch thick

steps: Season the lamb with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Saut√© onion and shallots for 5‚Äì10 minutes until starting to brown. Add the lamb and saut√© for 10 minutes until browned.
Add the stock, water, and diced soup greens (or carrot and parsley). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer for 1 hour, until the meat is tender.
Remove the pot from heat and refrigerate overnight or let cool for 8 hours. Skim the solidified fat from the surface.
Return the stock and meat to the pot. Add potatoes, carrots, parsnips, and celeriac. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.
Add leeks and simmer for an additional 15‚Äì25 minutes, until all vegetables are tender. Add water if needed to maintain consistency.
If using lamb shoulder, remove and slice the meat before serving. If using stew meat, serve as is.
Ladle stew into bowls, garnish with parsley, and serve with bread and cheese.

recipe.name: Jamaican Brown Stew Fish
recipe.description: A traditional Caribbean dish where seasoned fish is fried to a golden crisp and simmered in a rich, aromatic sauce made with bell peppers, tomatoes, thyme, and Scotch bonnet pepper. Best served with rice and peas or sweet plantains.

ingredients.ingredient_name: whole snapper, scaled, fins removed, and gutted
dried jerk seasoning or all-purpose seasoning
mixed bell peppers, sliced (red, green, yellow, orange)

steps: Score the snapper by making slits on both sides with a knife. Pat fish dry and season the outside and inner cavity with salt, pepper, and jerk seasoning. Set aside.

Heat vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 whole garlic cloves and 2 thyme sprigs to infuse the oil. Fry the snapper in batches for 5 minutes per side until golden and crisp. Remove and drain on a wire rack or paper towel.

Reserve 2 tablespoons of oil in the skillet and discard the rest. Reduce heat to medium and add bell peppers, onion, tomato, carrots, scallions, remaining thyme, and Scotch bonnet pepper. Saut√© for 2 minutes.
Chop the remaining garlic and add to the skillet. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Stir in ketchup, browning sauce, soy sauce, pimento seeds, and water. Mix well.
Return the snapper to the skillet and spoon sauce over the fish. Cover and simmer for 2‚Äì5 minutes. Uncover, spoon sauce again, and serve with rice and peas or sweet plantains.

recipe.name: Broccoli, White Bean & Cheddar Bake
recipe.description: A comforting one-skillet dinner combining caramelized tomato paste, broccoli, white beans, and melty cheddar cheese. Perfect with crusty bread for sopping up the delicious sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: anchovies, minced and smashed into a paste

steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F.
In a 12-inch ovenproof skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Saut√© for 6‚Äì8 minutes until golden.
Stir in anchovies and garlic, cooking for 1 minute. Add tomato paste and stir for 30 seconds, lowering the heat to avoid burning.
Add broccoli and stir to coat in tomato paste. Cook for 3 minutes until broccoli softens slightly. Add stock, white beans, lemon zest, and red wine vinegar. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar over the mixture and transfer the skillet to the oven. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes until cheese is browned and bubbly. Serve warm with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Heirloom Tomato Salad With Curry Lime Yogurt Dressing & Pickled Onions
recipe.description: A vibrant salad featuring heirloom tomatoes, Thai basil, a tangy curry lime yogurt dressing, and quick-pickled red onions, perfect for summer gatherings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colorful heirloom tomatoes, halved or quartered if large
fresh Thai basil, torn, plus small leaves for garnish
red onion, thinly sliced into half-moons

steps: In a medium bowl, gently toss tomatoes and torn basil with smoked sea salt and black pepper. Let stand for 10 minutes.
To prepare the dressing: Whisk yogurt, olive oil, curry powder, and lime juice until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste, then chill until ready to use.

For the pickled onions: Combine vinegar, sugar, coriander seeds, 1 cup water, and kosher salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 5‚Äì8 minutes. Pour over onions in a heatproof container and let cool to room temperature.
To assemble: Spread curry lime yogurt dressing on a serving platter. Top with tomato mixture. Garnish with pickled onions and basil leaves. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Bell-less, Whistle-less, Damn Good French Toast
recipe.description: A simple and delicious French toast recipe made with challah bread, eggs, heavy cream, and butter, resulting in a rich, custardy interior and a slightly crisp exterior.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and heavy cream until smooth.
Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and melt the butter.
Dip each slice of challah bread into the egg mixture, ensuring it is fully coated but not soggy.
Cook the bread slices in the pan for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and slightly crisp.
Serve warm with maple syrup or your favorite toppings.

recipe.name: Baked Eggs with Mushrooms and Gruyere
recipe.description: A rich and comforting dish of eggs baked with saut√©ed mushrooms, cream, and Gruyere cheese, creating a perfect balance of creamy and savory flavors.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and saut√© until soft and browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Crack the eggs into small ramekins or a baking dish.
Spoon the mushroom mixture evenly over the eggs.
Sprinkle the grated Gruyere cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are set but still soft in the center.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and garnish with thyme before serving.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Spinach, and Chorizo Frittata
recipe.description: A savory, spicy, and hearty frittata combining chickpeas, spinach, and chorizo, perfect for a full meal or as a tapas dish.
steps: Heat the oil in a 10-inch frying pan with a heatproof handle. Add the chorizo and cook over low heat until the fat begins to run.
Add the chickpeas and spinach and cook gently for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the milk, paprika, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour this over the chickpeas and spinach mixture.
Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, or until the frittata is set but still slightly runny on top.
Meanwhile, heat the broiler to high.
Place the frying pan under the broiler for 2-3 minutes until the top is just set and lightly browned.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipe.name: Black Pepper Popovers with Chives and Parmesan
recipe.description: Delicate and savory popovers infused with fresh chives, Parmesan cheese, and a hint of black pepper, perfect for any meal.
steps: Heat the oven to 450¬∞F. Lightly coat a 12-cup popover pan or muffin tin with melted butter or oil.
Whisk together the milk, eggs, and melted butter in a large bowl until blended. Add the flour, salt, black pepper, Parmesan cheese, chives, and lemon zest; mix well.

Place the empty pan in the oven to heat for 7 minutes. Carefully remove from the oven and fill the cups evenly with the batter (transferring the batter to a 4-cup liquid measuring cup can make this less messy).
Bake for 18-20 minutes, then lower the oven temperature to 350¬∞F. Continue baking until the popovers are deep golden brown, about 15-18 more minutes.
Cool briefly in the pan before removing and serving. To reheat cooled popovers, place them in a 350¬∞F oven for about 5 minutes.

recipe.name: Spice Merchant Cauliflower Couscous
recipe.description: A deeply spiced cauliflower dish masquerading as couscous, blended with a mix of spices, citrus, nuts, and raisins.
steps: Place the sultanas in a bowl and pour warm water over them. Leave the sultanas for about 15 minutes, until plump. Drain and discard the water.

Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Reduce the heat to medium low, add the cashew nuts and toast them for about 8 minutes, until lightly golden and gently charred. Stir frequently to make sure that cashew nuts do not burn. Let the cashew nuts cool. Cut half of the cashew nuts into smaller pieces (or simply crush them with your hands).

Break the cauliflower into florets, making sure to leave behind as much of the stem as possible. Chop the florets into smaller pieces. Transfer the cauliflower into a food processor in batches, and pulse until the pieces are finely chopped and resemble couscous. Be careful not to over-process.
In a large saut√© pan, heat three tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the cauliflower couscous to the pan and cook for about 7 minutes, stirring frequently.

Remove the couscous from the heat and let it cool. Add the sultanas, cashew nuts, za‚Äôatar, cumin, parsley, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, and the remaining two tablespoons of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Leave the couscous for about 15 minutes for the flavors to combine. Serve at room temperature.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Bourbon Banana Bread
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful banana bread enhanced with nutty brown butter and a splash of bourbon, offering a delightful twist on a classic favorite.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Grease only the bottom of a standard size loaf pan with butter or nonstick cooking spray.
Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.
Melt butter over medium heat in a small, heavy-bottomed pot. Cook until it begins to brown, but not burn; it will smell nutty and fragrant. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Peel and dice one banana. Mash the remaining two bananas in a small bowl; set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the brown sugar in a small skillet over medium heat until it begins to melt and turn golden. Add diced banana pieces and saut√© until well coated and caramelized. Remove from the pan and set aside.

Beat eggs on medium speed in a stand mixer. Add the remaining brown sugar and beat until foamy and combined. Add the mashed bananas, cooled browned butter, vanilla, and bourbon; beat until mixed well. Scrape down sides of bowl again with rubber spatula.

On low speed, pour in one-third of the flour mixture. Increase mixer speed to medium and mix until just blended. Pour in one-third of buttermilk and beat until just blended. Repeat this process with remaining flour and buttermilk.
Fold in pecans and caramelized banana pieces. Pour into prepared loaf pan and bake for 55 to 60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

recipe.name: Andrew Feinberg's Slow-Baked Broccoli Frittata
recipe.description: A custardy and creamy frittata featuring roasted broccoli and a gentle, slow-bake method for a tender texture.
steps: Heat the oven to 400¬∞F. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, cheese, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and the black pepper; set aside.

Trim ¬Ω inch off the stem of the broccoli. Using a knife, separate all the florets from the base, leaving the stem attached. Cut the florets in half (you can cut any especially large ones into quarters so all are evenly sized).

In a 10- to 11-inch oven-safe saut√© pan over medium-high heat, warm ¬º cup of the oil. Cook the broccoli, mostly undisturbed to develop a nice brown color on one side, then turn and season with salt. Transfer the pan to the oven and roast for 10 to 15 minutes, until tender.

In another 10- to 11-inch saut√© pan over medium-high heat, warm 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add the onions, season with salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 5 minutes, until lightly browned.
Once the broccoli is roasted, return the pan to the stovetop and reduce the oven temperature to 300¬∞F.

Heat the broccoli over medium heat, then add the garlic, red pepper flakes, and 1 tablespoon of the oil. Carefully cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute, so as not to burn the garlic. Add the onions to the broccoli and mix well to combine. Add the egg mixture, increase the heat to high, and cook for 30 seconds.

Transfer the pan to the oven and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the eggs are just set. Using a rubber spatula, turn out the frittata onto a serving plate. Squeeze the lemon juice over the top, drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with Parmigiano Reggiano.

recipe.name: Bert Greene's Potato Scallion Cakes (Fritterra)
recipe.description: A delightful way to repurpose leftover mashed potatoes by combining them with scallions and frying into golden cakes.
steps: Wash and trim the scallions, leaving about 2 inches of green stems. Cook in boiling water until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and chop finely.
Place the scallions in a medium-sized bowl. Add the eggs, nutmeg, salt, pepper to taste, bread crumbs, and mashed potatoes. Mix well.

Heat the oils in a large skillet until hot but not smoking. Shape the onion-potato mixture into patties, using 2 rounded tablespoons of the mixture for each patty. Saut√©, about six at a time, until golden brown on both sides, 2 or 3 minutes per side. Keep warm while saut√©ing the remaining patties.

recipe.name: Cinnamon Sugar Breakfast Puffs
recipe.description: A delightful hybrid of spice cake, muffins, and cinnamon sugar donut holes, offering a cakey and light texture with crisp edges and a crunchy cinnamon sugar coating.
steps: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the 1/3 cup butter over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until browned and nutty smelling. Pour into a mixing bowl and allow to cool completely to room temperature.
Preheat your oven to 350¬∞F. Grease and lightly flour a 12-cup muffin tin.
Add the sugar and egg to the cooled butter. Beat with an electric mixer until all creamed together, lightened in color, and fluffy (about 5 minutes).
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, spices, and orange zest.
Add the dry ingredients in increments to the butter-sugar mixture, alternating with the milk and beating until fully combined after each addition.
Divide the batter evenly into the cups of the muffin tin. Bake until golden brown and fragrant, about 20-25 minutes.
While the puffs are baking, put the melted butter in one shallow bowl and combine the sugar and cinnamon in another.

When the puffs come out of the oven, use a knife to gently pop them all out of the muffin tin. One by one, dip each puff in the melted butter‚Äîget it all over it‚Äîthen roll it in the cinnamon sugar. Transfer to a serving platter and continue until all puffs are coated. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Tomato-y, Yogurt-y Shakshuka
recipe.description: A flavorful North African dish featuring eggs poached in a spicy tomato and red pepper sauce, enhanced with dollops of yogurt for added tanginess.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Canned diced or crushed tomatoes (28-ounce can)

steps: In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the harissa, tomato paste, red peppers, garlic, cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Saut√© for about 10 minutes, until the peppers soften.
Add the canned tomatoes, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Make six little dips in the sauce. Gently break the eggs and carefully pour each into its own dip. Simmer gently for 8 to 10 minutes, until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Remove from heat, let it settle for a couple of minutes, then spoon into individual plates. Serve with dollops of labneh or Greek yogurt.

recipe.name: Aretha Frankenstein's Waffles of Insane Greatness
recipe.description: A morning-of alternative to overnight yeasted waffles, these feature cornstarch in the batter for a silky, moist interior and a thin, crisp crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Whole milk or buttermilk (or a combination)
Butter and pure maple syrup, for serving

steps: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; mix well.
Add the milk, vegetable oil, egg, sugar, and vanilla; mix well.
Let the batter sit for 30 minutes.
Heat a waffle iron. Follow the directions on your waffle iron to cook the waffles.
Serve immediately with butter and pure maple syrup, or hold in a 200¬∞F oven, directly on the rack (don't stack them or they'll get soggy). These also reheat very well in the toaster.

recipe.name: Savory Bread Pudding
recipe.description: A rich, custardy bread pudding featuring prosciutto, mushrooms, and goat cheese, perfect for a savory breakfast or brunch.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F.
Toast the bread cubes in the oven for about 10 minutes, stirring halfway through. Leave the oven on at 350¬∞F.
In a bowl, mix together the eggs, egg yolk, heavy cream, and milk until thoroughly blended.
In a 9x9-inch square baking pan, toss together the toasted bread cubes, prosciutto, shallots, mushrooms, thyme, and cracked pepper.
Gently stir in the crumbled chevre.
Pour the egg mixture over the bread mixture in the baking pan.
If desired, garnish with shredded gruyere or parmesan for a golden crust.
Bake in the oven for 40 minutes, or until a thermometer inserted into the center reads above 145¬∞F.

recipe.name: Lady & Pups's Magic 15-Second Creamy Scrambled Eggs
recipe.description: A quick and creamy scrambled eggs recipe that achieves a custard-like texture in just 15 seconds, thanks to the addition of cornstarch.
steps: Crack 3 eggs into a medium bowl.
In a separate cup or bowl, whisk together the milk and cornstarch until lump-free.
Add the milk and cornstarch mixture to the eggs and beat until smooth. Season with salt.
Heat a non-stick skillet over high heat until hot, then add the butter. Wait until the butter is melted and bubbly, but before it browns.
Add the beaten eggs. Wait for 3 seconds without stirring, until the edges of the eggs start to bubble up.
Remove the skillet from the heat and start stirring the eggs, making 1 full circle per second, for about 11 to 12 seconds. The eggs will have absorbed all the butter but remain partially undercooked.
Transfer the eggs onto a plate immediately. Do not wait until they look fully cooked.

recipe.name: Spanish-ish Tortilla in Cast Iron
recipe.description: A hearty Spanish-inspired tortilla combining potatoes and onions, cooked in a cast-iron skillet and finished with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_name: White or Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled

steps: Place the potatoes in a medium pot. Cover with water, season with about a tablespoon of salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are just tender when prodded with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain and let cool, then cut into 1/8-inch slices and put them in a large mixing bowl.

Heat the oven to 400¬∞F. Warm 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add the onions, season with salt, and cook until translucent and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Scrape the onions into the bowl with the potatoes.

Lightly whisk the eggs until smooth, then add them to the potatoes and onions, and gently fold everything together. The potatoes should not be sticking together‚Äîmake sure the egg separates each slice. Season with salt and pepper and fold once more.

Set a large nonstick or well-seasoned cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and the butter. When the butter foams, pour in the potato-and-egg mixture and pat it down so it's even on the top. Sprinkle the cheese on top, let the eggs set around the edges, and transfer the pan to the oven. Bake until the eggs are almost set in the middle and the tortilla is browned around the edges, about 20 minutes.

Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool on the stovetop. Run a thin spatula or knife around the edge of the tortilla to loosen it, then invert it onto a plate (this may be a 2-person job). If you'd like to serve the tortilla warm, invert it while it's still warm. Slice and serve. If you'd like to serve it with garlic mayonnaise, I won't argue.

recipe.name: Apricot-Almond Baked Oatmeal
recipe.description: A hearty and wholesome baked oatmeal studded with dried apricots and almonds, perfect for a warm and comforting breakfast.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Butter, divided (2 tablespoons melted, 2 tablespoons room temperature)

steps: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and generously butter a 9 x 9-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine the oats, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, and salt. Stir in the almonds and apricots. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish.
In a medium bowl, whisk the milk, cream, honey, 1/4 cup brown sugar, egg, 2 tablespoons melted butter, and vanilla to combine. Pour over the oats.
Dollop with remaining butter and sprinkle with remaining brown sugar.
Bake until the oatmeal has absorbed the liquid and is golden brown on the surface, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Hand-Formed Parmesan Tater Tots
recipe.description: Homemade tater tots made with roasted red potatoes, roasted garlic, and shredded Parmesan cheese, baked to crispy perfection.
steps: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Boil the red potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Let them cool slightly, then peel and grate them using a box grater.
Combine the grated potatoes, minced roasted garlic, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix gently until combined.
Form the potato mixture into small cylindrical shapes, about 1 inch long, to resemble tater tots.
Place the tater tots on the prepared baking sheet. Lightly brush them with olive oil or use cooking spray.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, turning halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

recipe.name: Lemony Cream Cheese Pancakes with Blueberries
recipe.description: Light and custardy pancakes infused with lemon zest and juice, featuring creamy pockets of cream cheese and bursts of blueberries, perfect for a delightful breakfast.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Cream cheese, cut into small cubes
Butter or cooking spray, for cooking

steps: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
Gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, being careful not to overmix. Fold in the cream cheese cubes and blueberries.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and grease with butter or cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the skillet. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with maple syrup, if desired.

recipe.name: Moroccan Merguez Ragout with Poached Eggs
recipe.description: A spicy and flavorful Moroccan-inspired ragout featuring merguez sausage and poached eggs, simmered in a rich tomato sauce infused with aromatic spices.
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and cook the merguez sausage until browned, breaking it up with a wooden spoon. Remove the sausage and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the onion and garlic. Saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the paprika and cumin, cooking for 1 minute to toast the spices.
Add the crushed tomatoes and cooked sausage to the skillet. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Make four small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and cook until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipe.name: Slow-Cooked Tuscan Kale with Pancetta, Bread Crumbs, and a Poached Egg
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful dish featuring slow-cooked Tuscan kale enriched with crispy pancetta and toasted bread crumbs, topped with a perfectly poached egg.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Tuscan kale, ribs removed, leaves roughly chopped

steps: In a large saut√© pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the minced garlic. Saut√© until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the chopped kale and chicken stock. Cover the pan and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the kale is tender, about 20 minutes.
Season the kale with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the crispy pancetta.
Divide the kale mixture among serving plates. Top each plate with a poached egg and sprinkle with toasted bread crumbs. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Crispy Duck Breasts With Pineapple-Scallion Sauce
recipe.description: Crispy-skinned duck breasts paired with a sweet and tangy pineapple-scallion sauce, perfect for a sophisticated dinner.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325¬∞F.

In a medium saucepan, combine pineapple preserves, pineapple juice, soy sauce, paprika, ¬Ω teaspoon salt, and chili flakes. Simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes until the preserves melt. Remove from heat and stir in scallions. Set aside to cool.
Pat duck breasts dry. Score the skin in a cross-hatch pattern, taking care not to pierce the flesh. Season both sides with 1 teaspoon salt. Apply Poultry Seasoning to the flesh side only.

Place duck breasts skin-side down in a cold, oven-safe skillet. Cook over high heat for 10 minutes to render fat. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes until the skin is golden and crispy. Drain excess fat as needed.

Flip the breasts and sear the flesh side for 3‚Äì4 minutes. Sear the sides for about 1 minute each. Transfer the skillet to the oven, flesh-side down, and bake for 5‚Äì6 minutes to an internal temperature of 135¬∞F for medium doneness.
Remove the duck breasts from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes before slicing into 1-inch pieces.
Serve sliced duck breasts with the pineapple-scallion sauce, warmed slightly if needed.

recipe.name: Surimi Ochazuke
recipe.description: A comforting Japanese dish featuring rice steeped in a flavorful surimi-infused dashi, topped with crispy pan-fried surimi, fresh vegetables, and garnishes like furikake and scallions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Wild Alaska Pollock surimi seafood, roughly torn
aji nori furikake, plus more for garnish

steps: Make the dashi: Fill a large pot with 2 quarts of water. Add surimi, garlic, onion, kombu, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain the dashi into another pot, reserving surimi, garlic, and onion. Discard kombu. Let the reserved ingredients cool, then slice the onion and garlic, and roughly chop the surimi.

Prepare the topping: Heat 1 teaspoon sesame oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Saut√© the sliced onion and garlic until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add remaining sesame oil, neutral oil, ¬Ω teaspoon soy sauce, and half of the chopped surimi. Pan-fry until crispy and golden, about 6 minutes. Repeat with the remaining surimi and soy sauce. Toss with 2 tablespoons furikake.
Bring the strained dashi to a boil. Add carrots and bok choy, cooking for 2‚Äì3 minutes until tender-crisp.

Assemble: Fill each bowl with 1 cup of rice. Ladle 1 ¬Ω cups of dashi over the rice, adding carrots and bok choy. Top with crispy surimi, additional furikake, and scallions. Serve with pickled ginger.

recipe.name: Shrimp Tacos Dorados, al Pastor-Style
recipe.description: Crispy, golden tacos filled with charred shrimp, sweet pineapple, and a smoky, tangy sauce, inspired by al pastor flavors.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chiles de √°rbol (seeds removed for milder flavor)

steps: In a saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil and add guajillo and morita chiles. Cover, remove from heat, and let sit for 30 minutes to soften.
Transfer chiles and soaking liquid to a blender. Add garlic, orange juice, achiote paste, cloves, sugar, and salt. Blend until smooth. Marinate shrimp in this mixture for 30 minutes to 2 hours.
Prepare a grill for medium-high heat. Grill pineapple until charred, about 10‚Äì12 minutes. Thinly slice and set aside. Grill tomatoes until charred, then chop into 1-inch pieces.
Grill shrimp for 2 minutes per side until cooked through and lightly charred.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan. Add chiles de √°rbol and garlic, cooking until fragrant. Add grilled tomatoes, 1 cup water, and cook until tender. Mash into a chunky salsa and season with salt. Add lime juice if desired.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep saucepan to 375¬∞F. Fry tortillas one at a time, shaping into a taco as they fry, until golden and crisp.
Fill tortillas with shrimp, pineapple slices, onion, and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.

recipe.name: Chile-Lime Chicken & Broccoli Salad
recipe.description: A vibrant, zesty chicken salad featuring marinated and broiled chicken thighs, charred broccoli and corn, fresh tomatoes, and a chile-lime vinaigrette, perfect for any meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cilantro (leaves and tender stems), coarsely chopped
red pepper flakes or cayenne powder

steps: Prepare the chile-lime vinaigrette: In a small bowl, combine lime zest, lime juice, honey, chile powder, red pepper flakes, olive oil, and soy sauce. Whisk until emulsified. Adjust acid and seasoning to taste. Refrigerate until needed.
Marinate the chicken: Toss chicken thighs with 3 tablespoons of vinaigrette and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Let marinate while preparing other ingredients, or refrigerate up to 4 hours.

Preheat the broiler. Line a sheet pan with foil and place a wire rack over it. Arrange the chicken thighs on the rack and broil for 4‚Äì5 minutes per side, until charred and cooked through (165¬∞F). Transfer chicken to a plate to rest.
Char the vegetables: Toss broccoli and corn kernels with 2 tablespoons vinaigrette and chicken fat from the pan. Broil for 3‚Äì5 minutes until lightly charred and crisp-tender.

Assemble the salad: In a large bowl, toss cherry tomatoes with a pinch of salt. Thinly slice the chicken and add it to the bowl with the broccoli, corn, almonds, and cilantro. Drizzle with vinaigrette to taste. Serve warm, at room temperature, or cold.

recipe.name: Harissa Lamb Orecchiette With Mustard Greens
recipe.description: A flavorful pasta dish combining homemade orecchiette with spiced ground lamb, smoky harissa, bright orange zest, and tender mustard greens, topped with crunchy pistachios.

ingredients.ingredient_name: semolina flour, plus more as needed
tepid water, plus more as needed
small yellow or white onion, minced
harissa paste, plus more as needed

steps: To make the orecchiette, combine AP flour, semolina flour, and 1 tsp salt in a bowl. Stir in tepid water to form a dough and knead for 10 minutes. Let rest for at least 1 hour.
Roll the dough into logs, cut into pieces, and shape into orecchiette using your thumb. Cook in boiling salted water until al dente, about 3 minutes.

For the lamb, heat grapeseed oil in a saut√© pan. Cook lamb, onion, and 1 tsp salt until browned and softened, about 4 minutes. Add cumin, minced garlic, harissa, orange zest, and tomato paste. Simmer for 3 minutes.
In another pan, heat olive oil. Add mustard greens and saut√© until wilted, about 3 minutes. Add sliced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Toss the orecchiette with lamb, greens, pistachios, and red pepper flakes. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Oven-Roasted Egyptian Mesaka‚Äôa
recipe.description: A simplified and flavorful Egyptian eggplant casserole with roasted eggplant, cinnamon-spiced tomato sauce, and optional ground beef, served with rice or pita bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
green or red bell peppers, seeded and roughly chopped
beef or chicken stock (or water for vegetarian)
cooked white rice or pita bread

steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Slice the eggplants crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick disks and arrange on a sheet pan. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil and season with salt. Roast for 30‚Äì35 minutes until caramelized.
While eggplant roasts, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onion and bell peppers until browned and softened.
Add tomato paste, cinnamon, paprika, cumin, and chili powder (if using). Cook for 2 minutes until the tomato paste darkens slightly.
Add garlic and ground beef (if using). Cook for 1‚Äì2 minutes until the beef begins to brown.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and stock (or water). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.
Layer half the roasted eggplant in a 3-quart baking dish. Top with half the sauce, then sprinkle with almonds (if using). Repeat with remaining eggplant and sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 more minutes. Serve hot with rice or pita bread.

recipe.name: Mee Goreng Mamak (Mamak-Style Stir-Fried Noodles)
recipe.description: A flavorful and nostalgic Malaysian noodle dish combining fresh yellow noodles with a savory-sweet sauce, potatoes, tofu, and choy sum, perfect for a quick dinner.
steps: Wash and boil the potato until fork-tender, about 30 minutes. Peel and cut into cubes.
Mix all sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
Rinse fresh yellow noodles in cold water to loosen and remove excess oil, or blanch briefly in hot water.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a wok. Saut√© garlic until aromatic. Add choy sum and noodles, tossing to combine.
Push ingredients to the side, add more oil if needed, and pour in the plant-based 'egg'. Let it set before mixing with the noodles.
Add cooked potato cubes, tofu slices, and the prepared sauce. Toss gently to combine, taking care not to break the noodles.
Fold in mung bean sprouts and cook for another minute. Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve topped with shredded green lettuce, chili slices, fried shallots, and lime wedges.

recipe.name: Epic Cobb Salad for One
recipe.description: A decadent Cobb salad perfect for one, featuring crispy bacon, juicy chicken thigh, creamy avocado, blue cheese, tomatoes, and a perfectly boiled egg, arranged on a bed of radicchio.

ingredients.ingredient_name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
large organic egg, boiled and quartered

steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F.
In a cold, oven-safe pan over medium heat, cook bacon for 8‚Äì10 minutes until crispy on both sides. Remove and set aside.

Season chicken thigh with salt and pepper. Sear skin-side down in the bacon fat for 2‚Äì3 minutes. Turn over and roast in the oven for 15 minutes, or until cooked through. Let cool slightly, then carve into bite-size pieces.
Arrange radicchio on a large plate. Drizzle with malt vinegar, olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Assemble the salad: Arrange bacon, chicken, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, and egg in sections over the radicchio. Season tomatoes, avocado, and egg with salt and pepper. Garnish with chives.

recipe.name: Summer Vegetable and Glass Noodle Salad
recipe.description: A refreshing noodle salad inspired by Vietnamese flavors, featuring vermicelli noodles, shredded chicken, fresh summer vegetables, herbs, and a tangy lime-fish sauce dressing.

ingredients.ingredient_name: light brown sugar or agave nectar

steps: In a large bowl, whisk together lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, and chile. Add 3 tablespoons of water to thin the dressing.
Add the cooked vermicelli noodles, chicken, cucumber, carrot, beets, herbs, and peanuts to the bowl. Toss everything together to coat evenly in the dressing.
Serve immediately, chilled, or at room temperature.

recipe.name: Vicky Bennison's 'Cupboard Is Bare' Pasta & Chickpeas
recipe.description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish made with pantry staples like canned chickpeas, garlic, and rosemary, finished with Parmigiano for a quick and delicious meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: good-quality pasta (e.g., fusilli lungi, penne, or orecchiette)

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat a generous drizzle of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently until softened but not browned.
Add the drained chickpeas to the pan and stir well. Use the back of a spoon to crush about half of the chickpeas for a creamier texture.
Stir in the minced rosemary and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Add a ladleful of the starchy pasta cooking water and let it simmer for about a minute.
Drain the pasta and toss it in the pan with the chickpea mixture. Mix well to coat the pasta.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmigiano.

recipe.name: Colby Garrelts' Grilled Pork Loin with Green Bean Arugula Salad
recipe.description: A perfectly grilled pork loin marinated in a tangy mustard-horseradish mixture, served alongside a refreshing green bean and arugula salad topped with goat cheese and prosciutto.

ingredients.ingredient_name: thinly sliced prosciutto, torn into pieces

steps: Place the pork loin in a resealable plastic bag. Mix olive oil, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, horseradish, and garlic in a bowl and pour over the pork. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.

Preheat the grill to medium heat. Remove pork from the marinade and pat lightly to dry. Grill for 18‚Äì20 minutes per pound, turning occasionally, until the internal temperature reaches 145¬∞F‚Äì160¬∞F. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Prepare the salad: Whisk rice wine vinegar, olive oil, honey, and lemon juice in a bowl to make the dressing. Boil green beans in salted water for 2‚Äì3 minutes until bright green. Transfer to an ice bath to cool, then drain.
In a large bowl, toss green beans with arugula and dressing. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, divide the green bean salad among plates. Top with goat cheese and prosciutto pieces. Arrange sliced pork loin alongside the salad.

recipe.name: Pork Piccata
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful twist on classic piccata, featuring thinly pounded pork loin slices saut√©ed to perfection, topped with a tangy lemon-caper sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Smithfield Roasted Garlic and Herb Marinated Fresh Pork Loin Filet

steps: Slice the pork loin into 1/4-inch slices and lightly pound them until thin. Season both sides with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour, shaking off excess.
Heat 4 tablespoons of butter and the olive oil in a large saut√© pan over medium-high heat. Saut√© pork slices for 3 minutes per side until nicely browned.
Remove pork from the pan. Deglaze the pan with lemon juice, chicken stock, and capers, scraping the bottom with a wooden spoon. Cook until the liquid reduces by about 1/3.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper, then stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to slightly thicken.
Plate the pork and spoon the lemon-caper sauce over it. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipe.name: Amazonian Fried Rice (Chaufa Amaz√≥nico)
recipe.description: A unique twist on Peruvian-Chinese fried rice featuring bacon, fresh chorizo, plantains, and a medley of aromatic flavors for a smoky, sweet, and savory dish.
steps: Heat a large wok or saut√© pan over medium-high heat. Add the vegetable oil and bacon. Cook until the bacon starts to brown, then add the chorizo and cook until both are browned and crisp. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside.
In the same pan, cook the beaten eggs in the rendered fat, swirling to cover the surface. Once set, break them up into pieces with a spatula and remove them from the pan.
Add a bit more oil if needed and fry the plantains until browned. Add garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until aromatic.
Return the bacon, chorizo, and eggs to the pan. Add the rice, scallions, sachaculantro, and red bell pepper. Stir to combine thoroughly.
Drizzle with soy sauce and stir-fry until the rice is heated through and slightly toasty. Serve immediately, optionally with a drizzle of aj√≠ sauce.

recipe.name: Meyer Lemon Galette With Saut√©ed Greens, Rainbow Carrots & Sweet Potato Mash
recipe.description: A rustic galette combining sweet potatoes, vibrant greens, and carrots, complemented by a tangy Meyer lemon vinaigrette and a tender, whole-grain crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: leafy greens (kale, Swiss chard, spinach), coarsely chopped
egg mixed with water (for egg wash)

steps: Prepare saut√©ed greens: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add onions and carrots, cooking until soft. Stir in garlic and greens, seasoning with salt and pepper. Finish with Meyer lemon juice. Set aside.
Boil sweet potatoes until tender. Mash with butter, Meyer lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Make the galette crust: Mix flours, cornmeal, salt, pepper, and lemon zest in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Gradually add cold water to form dough. Chill for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Roll out dough and transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet. Spread mashed sweet potatoes in the center, leaving a border. Layer greens and carrots on top.
Fold edges of the dough over the filling, brush with egg wash, and place lemon slices on top. Bake for 45‚Äì50 minutes, until golden brown. Serve with grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.

recipe.name: Vegetarian French Onion Soup With Asparagus & Cheesy Croutons
recipe.description: A lighter take on French onion soup featuring deeply caramelized onions, tangy vermouth, fresh asparagus, and cheesy croutons for a spring-inspired twist on the classic.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dry vermouth (or white wine vinegar with water)
vegan Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce (optional)
crusty bread, torn into 1- to 2-inch pieces
asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

steps: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring every 5 minutes, until onions are deeply caramelized, about 40‚Äì50 minutes. Scrape the bottom of the pot occasionally and add a splash of water if needed.
Stir in vermouth and cook for 2 minutes. Add Worcestershire sauce and 8 cups water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 20 minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Toss bread pieces with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 15‚Äì20 minutes until crispy. Sprinkle cheese over croutons and bake for an additional 2‚Äì3 minutes until melted.
Just before serving, stir asparagus into the soup and cook until bright green, about 2 minutes.
Ladle soup into bowls and top with cheesy croutons. Garnish with black pepper.

recipe.name: Pork Tenderloin With Apples & Kimchi
recipe.description: A vibrant dish featuring brined pork tenderloin roasted with tangy kimchi and sweet apples, served with a glossy, buttery kimchi sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: medium apples, cored and cut into chunks

steps: Brine the pork: Combine water, kimchi brine, and salt in a bowl or bag. Submerge pork tenderloin and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 12 hours.
Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Remove pork from the brine, pat dry, and let rest at room temperature.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add canola oil and sear pork tenderloin on all sides, about 6 minutes total.
Add chopped kimchi and apple chunks to the skillet, distributing evenly around the pork. Pour additional kimchi brine over the mixture and scatter butter pieces.
Roast in the oven for 12‚Äì15 minutes, flipping the pork halfway through, until the internal temperature reaches 140¬∞ to 145¬∞F.
Let the pork rest for a few minutes, then slice and serve over the roasted kimchi and apples with the pan sauce.

recipe.name: Vegan Mushroom Pie With Melted Leeks & Herbs
recipe.description: A savory, plant-based mushroom pot pie featuring creamy melted leeks, earthy mushrooms, and herbs, encased in a golden vegan puff pastry crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large leeks, thinly sliced (white and pale green parts only)
mixed mushrooms (shiitake, cremini, oyster, maitake, trumpet), sliced
dry white wine, cider vinegar, or apple cider
vegetable stock or plain unsweetened oat milk
aquafaba or melted vegan butter (for brushing)

steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F.
In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add leeks and saut√© until softened, 6‚Äì8 minutes. Set aside.
Add remaining olive oil to the skillet and saut√© mushrooms with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes until browned and most liquid is evaporated, 6‚Äì8 minutes. Remove and set aside with the leeks.
In the same skillet, melt vegan butter. Add garlic, thyme, and sage, cooking until fragrant, about 1‚Äì2 minutes. Stir in miso paste and cook for 30 seconds.

Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1‚Äì2 minutes. Deglaze with white wine, then slowly add vegetable stock or oat milk, stirring until smooth. Bring to a simmer and stir in nutritional yeast (if using). Add mushrooms and leeks back to the skillet and cook until thickened.
Transfer the mixture to a 2-quart baking dish and smooth into an even layer.
Roll out puff pastry slightly to fit the dish with a 1/4-inch overhang. Place pastry over filling, seal edges, and make slits for steam. Brush with aquafaba or vegan butter.
Bake for 15 minutes at 400¬∞F, then lower to 375¬∞F and bake for 25‚Äì30 minutes until golden brown. Cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Walnut-Lentil Lettuce Wraps
recipe.description: A simple, pantry-driven recipe featuring hearty lentils, toasted walnuts, and tangy pickled vegetables, served in lettuce leaves for a refreshing and light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: finely chopped pickled or fermented vegetables

steps: In a saucepan, combine lentils with 2 cups of water. Bring to a confident simmer, then reduce to a soft simmer for 20‚Äì30 minutes until tender. Drain and drizzle with pickle brine to taste while still warm.
Combine 2 tablespoons of canola oil and 2 tablespoons of pickle brine in a small bowl. Shake or whisk until emulsified. Taste and season with salt as needed.

Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add 2 teaspoons of canola oil. Toast the walnuts, stirring frequently, until golden and fragrant, about 2‚Äì3 minutes. Add the remaining teaspoon of oil and the cooked lentils.
Using a fork or potato masher, lightly smash the lentil-walnut mixture to break it down while keeping it chunky. Season with salt to taste.
To serve, arrange lettuce leaves on a plate. Fill each with the lentil-walnut mixture and drizzle with the pickle brine dressing. Top with additional pickled vegetables if desired.

recipe.name: Gyoza (Japanese Fried Pork Dumplings)
recipe.description: A classic recipe for Japanese gyoza, featuring ground pork, cabbage, and garlic chives wrapped in delicate gyoza skins, pan-fried to perfection with a golden crispy bottom.
steps: In a bowl, massage chopped cabbage with 2 teaspoons of salt for 2 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes, then squeeze out excess moisture. Discard liquid.
Combine pork, cabbage, garlic, garlic chives, ginger, broth, soy sauce, sake, sesame oil, and pepper. Knead the mixture for 4‚Äì5 minutes until smooth. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Place gyoza wrappers on a clean surface. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of filling into the center of each wrapper. Dampen the edges with water and fold, pleating the front edge toward the center to seal.
Heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Arrange gyoza in the pan, pleated side up. Fry for 3‚Äì4 minutes until bottoms are golden brown.
Pour in ¬æ cup water and cover immediately. Steam for 5‚Äì6 minutes until water has evaporated. Remove the lid and cook for another 3 minutes to crisp up the bottoms.
Serve hot with dipping sauces like soy sauce, rice vinegar, or spicy chili oil.

recipe.name: Chorizo & Potato Tacos
recipe.description: A savory, satisfying taco recipe featuring crispy potatoes and flavorful fresh chorizo, served in warm corn tortillas and topped with fresh cilantro.

ingredients.ingredient_name: baking potatoes, scrubbed and cubed (¬Ω-inch pieces)

steps: Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water by 1 inch. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to medium and simmer for 8 minutes until just tender. Drain and shake the colander to dry the potatoes.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Crumble chorizo into the pan and cook for 8 minutes until browned and the liquid has evaporated.
Add the onion and drained potatoes to the skillet. Cook for about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are crisp. Add more oil if needed and season with salt to taste.
Divide the potato mixture among the warm tortillas and sprinkle with chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Asparagus With Fried Eggs & Sizzled Paprika Croutons
recipe.description: A simple yet satisfying dish highlighting crisp-tender asparagus, smoky paprika croutons, and perfectly fried eggs with runny yolks, perfect for any spring meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large slices crusty bread, torn into bite-sized pieces
asparagus, tough ends trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: In a skillet, heat 1 ¬Ω tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon butter, and garlic over medium heat. Add smoked paprika and bread pieces. Saut√© until croutons are lightly toasted and crisp, about 3 minutes. Move croutons to the edges of the skillet.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and asparagus to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Saut√© for about 4 minutes until the asparagus is crisp-tender and croutons are crispy.

In a separate skillet (or the same skillet with asparagus removed), heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Crack eggs into the skillet and season with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika. Fry until whites are crispy and yolks are runny, about 2‚Äì3 minutes.
Serve the asparagus and croutons topped with fried eggs. Enjoy warm.

recipe.name: Crawfish √âtouff√©e
recipe.description: A classic Louisiana dish with buttery, spiced crawfish stew served over rice. This version uses fresh ingredients like garlic, onion, and espelette for a balanced and vibrant flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large green bell pepper, finely chopped
chopped parsley leaves and tender stems

steps: In a small saucepan, melt ¬Ω cup butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 4‚Äì5 minutes, whisking until it turns golden but not brown. Set aside.
In a large pot, melt the remaining ¬Ω cup butter over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, and celery. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 4‚Äì5 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and bay leaf. Cook for another 4‚Äì6 minutes to develop the flavors.
Add salt, espelette, paprika, tomato paste, black pepper, and oregano. Cook for 2‚Äì3 minutes until the tomato paste darkens slightly.
Stir in the roux. Gradually whisk in chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10‚Äì12 minutes until thickened.
Add crawfish tails and cook for 5‚Äì7 minutes. Stir in scallions, parsley, lemon juice, hot sauce, and Worcestershire sauce. Heat through.
Serve over white rice, garnished with additional scallions, parsley, and lemon juice. Pair with crusty French bread.

recipe.name: Skillet Bibimbap
recipe.description: A quick and vibrant take on traditional Korean bibimbap, featuring a mix of caramelized rice, saut√©ed kale, marinated beef, and pickled radishes, topped with kimchi, seaweed, and a runny egg yolk.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless beef short rib, thinly sliced

steps: Marinate the beef overnight in a resealable bag with garlic, soy sauce, miso, sugar, sesame oil, and black pepper.
Cook the rice as desired. Rinse and soak it before cooking for a better texture.
In a small bowl, toss radishes with rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Heat 2 teaspoons sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add kale and saut√© for 2‚Äì3 minutes until charred. Remove and set aside.
Add 1 teaspoon sesame oil to the skillet and cook the marinated beef for 5‚Äì7 minutes until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add 1 tablespoon sesame oil and the cooked rice to the skillet. Fry for a minute, then press evenly across the skillet to form a crust.
Off the heat, assemble the toppings: kale, beef, radishes, kimchi, seaweed, and gochujang. Place the egg yolk in the center.
Return to medium-low heat to toast the rice crust for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Instant Pot Sambhar (Lentils with Tamarind Paste)
recipe.description: A classic South Indian lentil stew made with toor dal, tamarind, aromatic spices, and vegetables, enhanced by a flavorful tadka.
steps: In the Instant Pot, combine toor dal, 2 ¬Ω cups water, tomatoes, onion, sugar, salt, turmeric, cayenne, and sambhar spice mix. Stir to combine.
Secure the lid and cook on Manual High Pressure for 10 minutes. Let naturally release pressure for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure.
Puree the cooked mixture directly in the pot with an immersion blender until smooth.
Add remaining water, pearl onions, green beans, and tamarind concentrate to the pot. Secure the lid and cook on Manual High Pressure for 2 minutes. Quick-release pressure.
In a skillet, heat ghee over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds, chiles, and curry leaves. Cook until mustard seeds start to pop, about 30 seconds. Pour the tadka into the sambhar and mix.
Serve the sambhar hot, garnished with cilantro, over rice or with idli.

recipe.name: Boosted Jook
recipe.description: A comforting Chinese rice soup, also known as congee, simmered with fresh ginger and customizable with various toppings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Soy sauce or tamari, for serving

steps: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, combine the rice, ginger, and water or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil over high heat.
