Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 to 1.5 hours, until the rice breaks down and the jook reaches your desired consistency.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, topped with scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce or tamari, and an optional soft-boiled egg.

recipe.name: Maple Quinoa Granola
recipe.description: A crunchy and nutritious granola featuring oats, quinoa, nuts, seeds, and dried fruits, all sweetened with maple syrup and baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat your oven to 325¬∞F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, quinoa, almonds, pumpkin seeds, cinnamon, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the maple syrup and melted coconut oil.
Pour the wet mixture over the dry ingredients and stir well to coat everything evenly.
Spread the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet in an even layer.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden brown and fragrant.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely before stirring in the dried cranberries.
Store in an airtight container for up to two weeks.

recipe.name: Croissant French Toast
recipe.description: A decadent twist on the classic French toast, using buttery croissants dipped in an orange-infused custard, pan-fried to golden perfection, and served with a Cointreau-spiked maple syrup.
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, cream, orange zest, vanilla extract, and Cointreau or Grand Marnier (if using).
Dip the croissant halves into the egg mixture, making sure each side is coated well. Let them soak for about 15 seconds per side.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter.
Place the soaked croissant halves into the skillet and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Work in batches if necessary, adding more butter as needed.
Serve warm with a drizzle of maple syrup.

recipe.name: Avocado y Huevos Caliente
recipe.description: Inspired by Huevos Rancheros and Shakshouka, this dish features baked eggs nestled in avocado halves, served with a spicy tomato salsa, making it perfect for breakfast or dinner.
steps: Preheat your oven to 400¬∞F. Scoop out a small portion of each avocado half to create a larger cavity for the egg.
Crack one egg into each avocado half, being careful to avoid overflow. Place the avocado halves in a baking dish to keep them upright.
Bake the avocados for 12-15 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
While the avocados bake, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for an additional 5 minutes to create the salsa.
Serve the baked avocados topped with the warm salsa, fresh cilantro, and lime wedges.

recipe.name: Savory Oatmeal with Ham, Poached Eggs, and Hollandaise Sauce
recipe.description: A hearty and savory twist on traditional oatmeal, featuring creamy oats mixed with pesto, topped with ham slices, poached eggs, avocado, and a rich homemade hollandaise sauce.
steps: Cook the oats according to package instructions, then stir in the pesto and season with salt and pepper.
Divide the oatmeal among four serving bowls.
Top each bowl with a slice of warmed ham, a poached egg, and sliced avocado.
Drizzle with hollandaise sauce and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Sweet Potato Waffles, Sweet or Savory
recipe.description: Versatile sweet potato waffles that can be enjoyed with both sweet and savory toppings, making them perfect for any meal.
steps: Preheat your waffle iron and grease it if necessary.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon (if using).
In another bowl, mix the mashed sweet potato, eggs, milk, and melted butter until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Scoop the batter into the preheated waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions until golden and crispy.
Serve warm with your choice of sweet or savory toppings.

recipe.name: Healing Green Smoothie
recipe.description: A nutritious and refreshing green smoothie packed with fruits and vegetables, perfect for a healthy start to your day.
steps: Add the spinach, banana, avocado, pineapple, and coconut water to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add lime juice and grated ginger to taste, and blend briefly to combine.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional pineapple or lime if desired.

recipe.name: Morning Thunder Omelette
recipe.description: A hearty omelette inspired by the Morning Thunder Caf√©, featuring cream cheese, avocado, and a zesty homemade salsa.
steps: In a small bowl, whisk the eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Heat the butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in the eggs and cook, gently stirring, until just set.
Spread the cream cheese over one side of the omelette, then top with the sliced avocado.
Fold the omelette in half and cook for another 1-2 minutes until warmed through.
In a separate bowl, mix the diced tomato, chopped cilantro, and lime juice to make the salsa.
Serve the omelette hot with the fresh salsa on the side.

recipe.name: Breakfast Meatballs with Minted Soft-Scrambled Eggs
recipe.description: A delightful breakfast dish featuring savory meatballs paired with soft, minted scrambled eggs for a fresh twist.
steps: In a bowl, mix the ground beef, onion, breadcrumbs, milk, 1 egg, salt, and pepper until just combined.
Form the mixture into small meatballs and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook the meatballs until browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from skillet and keep warm.
In another bowl, whisk the remaining 5 eggs with the chopped mint, salt, and pepper.
In the same skillet, reduce the heat to low and add a bit more olive oil if needed. Pour in the egg mixture and cook gently, stirring occasionally, until soft and creamy.
Serve the meatballs with the minted scrambled eggs on the side.

recipe.name: Creamy Coconut Milk Millet Pudding
recipe.description: A rich and creamy pudding made with lightly toasted millet and coconut milk, scented with vanilla, cinnamon, and almond extract. Perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps: Lightly toast the millet in a dry saucepan over medium heat until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the coconut milk, water, vanilla extract, and cinnamon stick to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 25 minutes, or until the millet is tender and the mixture is creamy.
Remove the cinnamon stick and stir in the maple syrup. Adjust seasoning with salt, if needed.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with toasted coconut flakes.

recipe.name: Avocado, Feta, and Mint on Sourdough Toast
recipe.description: A delightful combination of creamy avocado, tangy feta, and fresh mint served on crusty sourdough toast. Perfect for a quick and flavorful breakfast or snack.
steps: Toast the sourdough slices until golden brown.
Layer the sliced avocado evenly across the toast.
Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese and chopped mint over the avocado.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and drizzle with olive oil.
Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Oatmeal with Almond Milk and Chia Seeds
recipe.description: A creamy and nutritious oatmeal made with unsweetened almond milk and chia seeds, topped with nuts and dried or fresh fruit. A quick and healthy breakfast option.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Unsalted nuts (e.g., walnuts, almonds, macadamia nuts)

steps: Place almond milk in a small saucepan and bring to a boil.
Stir in the oats. Cook for about 5 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Before removing from heat, add the chia seeds and stir.
Transfer to a bowl and stir in the nuts and dried or fresh fruits.
Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Honey Cloud Souffle Pancakes
recipe.description: Light, eggy, and sweet, these pancakes are the perfect cross between a traditional pancake and a Dutch baby, enhanced with fresh fruit and a hint of honey.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
In a small bowl, whisk the egg white until soft peaks form.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the whole egg and sweet rice flour until combined.
Add sea salt, honey, and vanilla extract to the egg mixture; whisk to combine.
Gradually add the warmed almond milk, whisking until the batter is smooth.
Gently fold the whipped egg white into the batter using a spatula or wooden spoon.
Heat a 6-inch ovenproof skillet over low heat on the stovetop for a minute or two.
Add clarified butter or coconut oil to the skillet, ensuring it coats the entire surface as it melts.
Pour the batter into the skillet and cook over medium-low heat for 2 to 3 minutes, until the edges begin to set.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup of fruit over the batter.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 7 to 8 minutes, until the pancake is puffed, golden, and the center is set.
Remove from the oven, drizzle with maple syrup, top with additional fruit, and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

recipe.name: Scrambled Egg Tacos
recipe.description: A quick and easy breakfast option featuring scrambled eggs mixed with tomatoes, onions, and jalape√±os, served in warm corn tortillas and topped with Cotija cheese and fresh cilantro.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Tomato, seeds and jelly removed, diced
Jalape√±o pepper, seeds and ribs removed, diced

steps: Warm both sides of the tortillas in a pan over low heat, a couple of minutes on each side.
Meanwhile, in another saut√© pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add in onions and a pinch of salt and cook until onions are soft, about a minute or two.
Add tomato and jalape√±o and cook, stirring, for another minute.
Add in the whisked eggs, folding them repeatedly until all ingredients are incorporated and eggs are fully set, about 2 more minutes.
Turn off the heat and sprinkle eggs with salt and pepper to taste.
Fill each warmed tortilla with an equal amount of cooked eggs, then top all tacos with the cheese, cilantro (or parsley), and Cholula Original hot sauce.

recipe.name: Tortang Talong (Filipino Eggplant Omelet)
recipe.description: A traditional Filipino dish featuring roasted eggplant dipped in beaten eggs and pan-fried to perfection. Often served with rice and a side of dipping sauce.
steps: Roast the eggplants over an open flame or under a broiler until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
Allow the eggplants to cool slightly, then peel off the skin, keeping the stems intact.
Flatten each eggplant gently with a fork, spreading the flesh evenly while keeping it intact.
Season the beaten eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Dip each eggplant into the beaten eggs, coating both sides, then place into the skillet.
Fry until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve hot with rice and your choice of dipping sauce.

recipe.name: Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Merguez, Persimmon, and Za'atar Yogurt
recipe.description: A flavorful dish combining roasted sweet potatoes, spiced lamb sausage, fresh persimmon slices, and a tangy za'atar-infused yogurt, garnished with parsley.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Sweet potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces

steps: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F.

Wash the sweet potatoes and cut them into bite-size pieces. Toss with olive oil, salt, and Espelette pepper. Roast until caramelized and crisp around the edges, approximately 20 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.

Remove the merguez sausage from its casing. In a large skillet over high heat, add grapeseed oil to coat the skillet. Heat until it begins to lightly smoke. Add the sausage, pressing into flat pancake shapes. Cook undisturbed until deeply caramelized on one side, then break up the sausage and cook through. Set aside to cool to room temperature.
In a medium bowl, mix the Greek yogurt with za'atar, lemon juice, a tablespoon of olive oil, and salt to taste.

To serve: Dollop yogurt onto the plate and spread gently. Sprinkle roasted sweet potatoes, sausage, and persimmon slices over the yogurt. Garnish with chopped parsley and drizzle with olive oil if desired.

recipe.name: Coconut Rice Pudding with Raspberries
recipe.description: A comforting dessert or filling breakfast featuring risotto rice slowly cooked in coconut milk, paired with tangy raspberries and crunchy pistachio nut brittle.
steps: Start by making the pistachio brittle. Put the sugar with 4 teaspoons of water into a small frying pan and leave to melt, stirring from time to time. Once the sugar syrup starts bubbling, stop stirring and leave to bubble until the caramel starts turning light golden. Add the pistachios and stir to coat them. Pour the pistachio brittle onto a piece of baking paper and leave to cool.
Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the rice. Stir for one minute until translucent.

Add a ladle of the coconut milk and the sugar, and bring to the boil while stirring. Once the risotto rice has absorbed most of the coconut milk, gradually add the rest of the coconut milk‚Äîa ladle at a time, stirring between each addition and only adding more coconut milk once all the liquid has been absorbed.
Repeat this process with the milk. In total, this will take approximately 20 minutes.
Break up the cooled pistachio brittle. Divide the rice pudding between four bowls, top with raspberries and pistachio brittle.

recipe.name: Balsamic Fried Eggs
recipe.description: A simple yet flavorful dish where eggs are fried in olive oil and finished with a drizzle of reduced balsamic vinegar, served atop toasted bread and garnished with arugula.
steps: Add olive oil to an 8-inch skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot but not at the smoking point, crack open the eggs, one at a time, letting each egg set. Cook for about 25 seconds, keeping the heat at medium. As the eggs puff up, season with salt and pepper. Tilt the pan and baste the top of the yolks with the oil to help them cook. Cook to desired doneness.
Place a piece of toast on each plate, top with an egg.

Pour off and discard any excess oil and remove any oily residue from the pan. Put the pan back over medium heat. Add the balsamic vinegar and let it sizzle and reduce slightly for a moment or two. Drizzle over the eggs.
Garnish with arugula and serve.

recipe.name: Vafler - Norwegian Heart Waffles
recipe.description: Traditional Norwegian heart-shaped waffles, delicately sweetened and flavored with cardamom and vanilla, perfect for a cozy breakfast or snack.
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar until light and frothy.
Add the flour, buttermilk, melted butter, cardamom, vanilla extract, and salt. Mix until smooth.
Preheat your heart-shaped waffle iron and lightly grease it with butter or cooking spray.
Pour a ladleful of batter into the waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions, until golden brown.
Serve warm with your favorite toppings such as jam, sour cream, or fresh fruit.

recipe.name: Raspberry and Goat Cheese Pancakes
recipe.description: Fluffy pancakes infused with the tang of goat cheese, fresh lemon zest, and thyme, studded with juicy raspberries for a delightful breakfast treat.
steps: Sift all dry ingredients together in a bowl.
Separate eggs into two separate bowls.
In the bowl with egg yolks, add goat cheese, milk, lemon juice and zest, and 1 tablespoon of fresh thyme leaves. Whisk together until smooth.
Add dry ingredients to wet and mix well, forming batter.
Beat egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Fold into pancake batter.

Melt butter on a preheated griddle. Ladle or spoon batter onto the griddle to desired size of pancake. Place 3 or 4 raspberries on each pancake. When you see some bubbles raising and bursting, you will know to flip it gently. Cook until the underside is golden.
Place pancake stack on a plate. Top with more raspberries and some thyme leaves. Sprinkle with a little powdered sugar. Serve.

recipe.name: Sweet Potato Breakfast Gnocchi
recipe.description: Delicate gnocchi made from sweet potatoes and ricotta, served with a maple-butter sauce infused with orange and cinnamon, topped with toasted pecans.

ingredients.ingredient_name: All-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

steps: Heat your oven to 400¬∞F. Wash your sweet potatoes and score them with an 'X'. Place them on a baking sheet and bake until very soft, close to an hour. Allow to cool, remove the peels, and press the potatoes through a potato ricer. Measure out one cup of the mashed sweet potato.

In a mixing bowl, stir together the sweet potato mash, ricotta, salt, and egg until combined. Then, stir in the flour 1/4 cup at a time, just until you have a workable dough. It will be sticky; use as little flour as possible to keep the gnocchi light.
Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface and keep your hands floured as well. Divide it into four pieces and roll each piece into a log about an inch thick.

Using a sharp knife, cut the logs into 1-inch pieces. Optionally, use the back of a fork to press tine marks into your gnocchi. If not cooking immediately, refrigerate them or freeze them on a baking sheet, then store in the freezer. Do not defrost frozen gnocchi; cook them directly from frozen.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Gently add about half of your gnocchi. Boil until they rise to the surface, then scoop them out with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl. Repeat with the remaining gnocchi.

For the maple-butter sauce: In a frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the orange zest, maple syrup, orange juice, rum (if using), and cinnamon. Stir to combine and let it cook for a couple of minutes until it thickens slightly.
Add the cooked gnocchi to the sauce, stirring to coat them well. Cook them on medium for a minute or two on each side, until they look a little golden.
Divide the gnocchi between four bowls and sprinkle each with the toasted pecans. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Olia Hercules' Watermelon Rind Jam
recipe.description: A clever way to use leftover watermelon rinds, transformed into a fragrant, slightly bitter-sweet jam flavored with lime.
steps: Peel the green skin off the watermelon rind and cut the white flesh into small cubes.
Place the watermelon rind in a large pot along with the sugar, lime juice, lime zest, and water.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for about 90 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rind is translucent and the liquid has thickened into a syrup.
Let the jam cool before transferring it to sterilized jars.
Store in the refrigerator and enjoy as a spread or topping.

recipe.name: Brown Butter Waffle Cake + Sorghum Meringue Buttercream
recipe.description: A unique cake composed of rich brown butter waffles layered with a sweet and slightly tangy sorghum meringue buttercream, perfect for breakfast lovers celebrating special occasions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Brown butter, cooled to room temperature
Unsalted butter, room temperature, cut into tablespoon-size pieces

steps: For the waffle cake: Whisk all dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl to combine well.
Whisk all wet ingredients together to combine in a separate bowl.
Stir wet ingredients into dry gently to just combine, being careful to not over-mix‚Äîthis will make the waffles tough.
Oil and heat your waffle iron and let the batter sit while you make your buttercream.

When waffle iron is hot, pour two small ladles of batter onto the griddle, close, and cook for 4 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Repeat with remaining batter. Cool waffles completely before assembling the cake.
Once waffles are cooled, stack two of them to form the first layer of the cake, slather with the buttercream, top with two more waffles and then another layer of buttercream. Finish with fresh fruit.
For the sorghum meringue buttercream: Mix egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium speed until they hold soft peaks.
Add in the sugar one teaspoon at a time, continuing to beat, until they just hold stiff peaks.
Boil the sorghum syrup without stirring in a small saucepan with a candy thermometer attached until it reaches 238¬∞F to 242¬∞F.

Immediately remove from heat and stream down side of bowl into egg whites, beating constantly on high. Beat until meringue is completely cool, 10 minutes or more depending on how warm your kitchen is, and then gradually whip in the sorghum.
Add the butter one tablespoon at a time, beating well between additions. If mixture looks curdled, just keep beating‚Äîit'll come together.
Buttercream can be made up to one week ahead, chilled and covered. To revive, just bring to room temp and whip back to life with your mixer.

recipe.name: Chilaquiles Verdes
recipe.description: A traditional Mexican dish of crispy corn tortillas simmered in tangy tomatillo sauce, topped with fresh cheese, cilantro, and optional eggs or shredded chicken.
steps: Heat the oil in a large skillet and fry the tortilla triangles in batches until crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels.
In a blender, combine the tomatillos, jalape√±os, onion, garlic, and chicken broth. Blend until smooth.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in the skillet and pour in the blended sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes until slightly thickened. Season with salt to taste.
Add the tortilla chips to the skillet and gently toss to coat in the sauce. Cook for 2 minutes to soften slightly.
Serve immediately, topped with crumbled cheese, chopped cilantro, fried eggs, or shredded chicken if desired.

recipe.name: Radish and Butter Tartine
recipe.description: A simple French-inspired open-faced sandwich featuring crisp radish slices on buttered bread, topped with flaky sea salt.
steps: Spread the softened butter generously on each slice of bread.
Arrange the radish slices evenly over the buttered bread.
Sprinkle with flaky sea salt to taste.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

recipe.name: Lamb Merguez
recipe.description: A spicy North African sausage made from ground lamb, seasoned with harissa and aromatic spices, perfect for grilling or pan-frying.
steps: In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, harissa paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, minced garlic, and salt.
Mix the ingredients together until well combined, being careful not to overwork the mixture.
Form the mixture into small sausage links or patties.
Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the merguez sausages for about 4 to 5 minutes per side, until browned and cooked through.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use.

recipe.name: Deviled Eggs, Purgatory Edition
recipe.description: A spicy twist on classic deviled eggs, featuring hot sauce and bold seasonings for an unforgettable kick.
steps: Slice the hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise and carefully scoop out the yolks.
Mash the yolks in a bowl and mix with mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, hot sauce, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Spoon or pipe the yolk mixture back into the egg whites.
Sprinkle with paprika for garnish and serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

recipe.name: Malted Chocolate Granola
recipe.description: A rich and crunchy granola blend featuring rolled oats, coconut flakes, seeds, and malt powder, all coated in a chocolate-infused syrup and baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325¬∞F (163¬∞C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, coconut flakes, pepitas, sunflower seeds, malt powder, and cocoa powder.
In a small saucepan over moderate heat, combine the water and brown sugar, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and cook for one minute.
Remove from heat and whisk in the coconut oil, chopped dark chocolate, and sea salt until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth.
Pour the hot chocolate syrup over the oat mixture and mix until well combined.
Spread the mixture evenly across a large jelly roll pan or two small rimmed baking sheets.
Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until the granola is crisp.
Let the granola cool completely before storing it in an airtight container.

recipe.name: Sweet Omelet with Berries
recipe.description: A delightful sweet omelet filled with a warm berry compote, offering a unique twist on a classic breakfast dish.
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and heavy cream together until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook gently, without stirring, until the edges start to set.
While the omelet cooks, heat the berries in a small saucepan over medium heat until they soften. Stir in the honey.
Carefully fold the omelet in half or thirds, then slide onto a plate.
Top with the warm berry compote and garnish with powdered sugar if desired.

recipe.name: Spicy Apple-Chorizo Hash
recipe.description: A bold and savory breakfast hash combining spicy chorizo, sweet apples, and tender potatoes, topped with fried eggs for a complete meal.
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and cook the diced potatoes until tender and golden, about 8‚Äì10 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining olive oil and cook the chorizo, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned and cooked through.
Add the diced onion, bell pepper, and garlic to the skillet. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the diced apple and cook for an additional 2‚Äì3 minutes, just until slightly softened.
Return the cooked potatoes to the skillet and mix everything together. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot with fried eggs on top if desired.

recipe.name: Caramelized Peach Pancakes
recipe.description: Fluffy pancakes topped with caramelized peach slices, offering a delightful combination of sweetness and a hint of caramel.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, mix the milk, egg, and melted butter. Pour into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.

Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake and cook until bubbles form on the surface. Flip and cook the other side until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.
In the same skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the peach slices and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Cook the peaches until caramelized, about 3‚Äì5 minutes, stirring gently to coat them in the syrup.
Serve the pancakes topped with caramelized peaches and drizzle any remaining syrup from the skillet over the top.

recipe.name: Roger Verg√©'s Fried Eggs with Wine Vinegar
recipe.description: A French-inspired dish where fried eggs are enhanced with a tangy reduction of wine vinegar for a unique flavor twist.
steps: Heat the butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat until it starts to foam.
Crack the eggs into the skillet, ensuring they don‚Äôt overlap. Cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 3 minutes.
Carefully transfer the fried eggs to serving plates and season with salt and black pepper.
In the same skillet, add the wine vinegar and swirl it around, letting it reduce slightly for 30 seconds.
Drizzle the vinegar reduction over the eggs and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Egg in a Bagel Hole
recipe.description: A fun and easy breakfast where a bagel becomes the perfect nest for a fried egg, crisped to perfection in butter.
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter.
Place the bagel halves, cut-side down, in the skillet and cook until lightly toasted, about 1 minute.
Flip the bagel halves over and crack an egg into the center hole of each bagel half.
Season with salt and black pepper, and cover the skillet with a lid. Cook until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 3‚Äì4 minutes.
Serve immediately while warm and crispy.

recipe.name: The BLT Benedict
recipe.description: A delightful fusion of the classic BLT sandwich and Eggs Benedict, featuring crispy bacon, fresh tomatoes, spring lettuce, poached eggs, and a rich hollandaise sauce atop toasted English muffins.
steps: Toast the English muffin halves and arrange them on serving plates.
Top each muffin half with a slice of crispy bacon, a leaf of lettuce, and a slice of tomato.
Place a poached egg on top of each stack.
Drizzle the warm hollandaise sauce over the eggs.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegetarian Ramen
recipe.description: A flavorful vegetarian ramen with a rich broth made from dried mushrooms, fresh vegetables, and savory seasonings, served with noodles and garnished with tofu and herbs.
steps: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the dried mushrooms and simmer for 15 minutes to create a rich broth.
Stir in the soy sauce, carrots, celery, and ginger. Cook for an additional 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Meanwhile, cook the ramen noodles according to the package instructions and drain.
Add the cubed tofu to the broth and heat through for 5 minutes.
Divide the cooked ramen noodles among serving bowls and ladle the hot broth and vegetables over the noodles.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Yogurt with Toasted Quinoa, Dates, and Almonds
recipe.description: A creamy bowl of Greek yogurt topped with nutty toasted quinoa, sweet dates, and crunchy almonds for a nutritious and satisfying meal.
steps: Toast the cooked quinoa in a dry skillet over medium heat for 2‚Äì3 minutes, stirring frequently until golden and nutty.
Divide the Greek yogurt between two serving bowls.
Top each bowl with toasted quinoa, chopped dates, and almonds.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with a pinch of salt to enhance the flavors.
Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Roasted Tomato Jam
recipe.description: A sweet and savory jam made by slow-roasting ripe tomatoes with sugar, lemon, and spices, perfect as a spread or condiment.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
In a large baking dish, combine the tomatoes, sugar, lemon juice, salt, cinnamon stick, and red pepper flakes.
Roast in the oven for 90 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are caramelized and the mixture has thickened.
Remove the cinnamon stick and let the jam cool.
Transfer the jam to a jar or airtight container and refrigerate. Serve as a spread or condiment.

recipe.name: Perez Family Paella
recipe.description: A traditional Spanish paella featuring mussels, clams, chorizo, chicken, and saffron-infused rice, cooked in a flat paella pan for even, flavorful results.

ingredients.ingredient_name: green asparagus stalks, cooked and halved

steps: Prep the mussels and clams: Boil in salted water until shells open. Remove, discard unopened shells, and reserve 4 cups of the cooking water. Add saffron to the water.
Heat olive oil in a skillet. Brown chicken drumsticks until golden and set aside.
Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. In a paella pan, saut√© garlic, onion, green pepper, and parsley in reserved olive oil until softened.
Add chicken, chorizo, and rice to the pan. Stir in tomatoes, peas, and saffron-infused seafood stock. Nestle the mussels, clams, and lobster pieces into the rice mixture.
Simmer on low heat for 5 minutes, then transfer the pan to the oven. Bake for 30‚Äì35 minutes, checking after 25 minutes to see if additional stock is needed.
Garnish with asparagus, pimientos, and sliced eggs before serving.

recipe.name: Grilled Peach & Apricot Salad
recipe.description: A summer salad featuring caramelized grilled peaches and apricots paired with kale, feta, and prosciutto, topped with a lemon-olive oil dressing.
steps: Preheat the grill to medium heat.

Tear or chop kale into bite-size pieces and place in a large salad bowl. Add a pinch of salt and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Massage the kale until softened. Whisk remaining olive oil and lemon juice for the dressing; set aside.
Brush apricots and peaches lightly with neutral oil. Grill cut side down until caramelized.
Toss the kale with dressing and crumble feta on top. Add prosciutto and warm peaches and apricots, letting their juices seep into the salad.
Serve with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Oyster and Spinach Chowder
recipe.description: A comforting and elegant chowder featuring freshly shucked oysters, creamy potatoes, tender spinach, and a touch of cream for a hearty yet refined dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: freshly shucked oysters and their liquor
diced onion or thinly sliced leek (white and light green parts only)
baby spinach leaves, thick stems discarded

steps: Combine the oyster liquor, clam juice, and water in a bowl. Set aside.
In a medium soup pot, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Saut√© the onion or leek until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.
Add the reserved broth mixture and potatoes to the pot. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream and bring back to a simmer. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add the oysters and their juices to the pot. Simmer for 3‚Äì4 minutes until the oysters are just cooked.
Season the chowder with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Corn, Bacon, and Clam Stew
recipe.description: A summery one-pot stew featuring smoky bacon, sweet corn, clams, and a hint of bourbon, finished with fresh basil and served with crusty bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: corn, shucked and kernels cut from the cobs
thick slices of country bread, grilled or toasted

steps: Heat olive oil in a large, deep soup pot over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until browned and the fat is rendered.
Stir in smoked paprika and cook for 30 seconds until aromatic.
Add corn kernels and season with salt. Stir and cook for 2 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes, cover, and cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes soften.
Squeeze in the lemon juice and pour in the bourbon. Stir, then turn off the heat.
Nestle the clams into the corn mixture with their mouths facing up. Turn the heat back to medium, cover, and cook until the clams open, 5‚Äì10 minutes.
Remove the pot from heat, sprinkle with torn basil leaves, and serve directly from the pot with toasted bread on the side.

recipe.name: Jalape√±o Chicken Meatballs
recipe.description: Spiced chicken meatballs with broccoli and a tangy yogurt sauce, baked on a sheet pan for a simple, flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: limes, zested, plus one cut into thin rounds

steps: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F. Toss broccoli with olive oil, ¬Ω teaspoon cumin, red pepper flakes, and salt. Rub lime rounds in residual oil and scatter everything on a sheet pan.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg and combine with 1 teaspoon cumin, salt, jalape√±o, cheese, 3 tablespoons yogurt, breadcrumbs, cilantro, lime zest, and ground chicken. Mix gently.
Shape the mixture into loose 1 ¬Ω-inch meatballs (about 20 total). Arrange them on the sheet pan among the broccoli, placing lime rounds on top of some meatballs.
Bake for 15‚Äì18 minutes, flipping broccoli halfway through. Broil for 1‚Äì2 minutes for more color on the meatballs.
While baking, mix remaining yogurt with lime juice and chopped cilantro. Season with salt.
Serve the meatballs with the yogurt sauce and roasted broccoli.

recipe.name: Spicy Black Bean & Sweet Potato Soup
recipe.description: A hearty vegetarian soup with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and a medley of spices, perfect for fall or any chilly day.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
red bell pepper, seeded and diced
jalape√±o pepper, seeded and finely diced

steps: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Toss cubed sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, ¬Ω teaspoon cumin, ¬Ω teaspoon chili powder, and salt. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.
In a large pot, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat. Saut√© onion until translucent, about 3‚Äì4 minutes.
Add garlic, red pepper, and jalape√±o to the pot. Saut√© until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in vegetable broth, tomatoes, remaining cumin, chili powder, coriander, oregano, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a gentle boil.
Reduce heat to simmer and add roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and corn. Simmer for 20‚Äì30 minutes.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Add cayenne or hot sauce if desired for extra heat. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Lemony Pasta With Sardines & Escarole
recipe.description: A quick and zesty pasta dish combining tinned sardines, escarole, lemon, and chile flakes for a light and flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: tinned sardines packed in olive oil
mild chile flakes (Aleppo, Espelette, or gochugaru)
head of escarole or romaine, roughly torn
chopped fresh dill, mint, or basil

steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
While the pasta cooks, drain the oil from the sardine tins into a large bowl. Grate garlic and lemon zest into the bowl, and stir in chile flakes.
Add the cooked pasta to the bowl and toss aggressively to coat in the garlicky oil.
Halve the lemon and squeeze its juice into the bowl. Add torn escarole and chopped herbs, then gently toss to combine.
Add the sardines, breaking them into smaller pieces if desired. Adjust seasoning with salt and chile flakes to taste.
Drizzle with extra olive oil before serving, if desired.

recipe.name: Asparagus With Soft-Boiled Eggs & Anchovy Bread Crumbs
recipe.description: Bright-green asparagus topped with anchovy bread crumbs, jammy eggs, and chile paste for a satisfying dinner or side dish.
steps: Bring water to a boil in a stockpot and add salt.
Make bread crumbs: Pulse bread in a food processor. Heat olive oil in a nonstick pan, add anchovies, then stir in bread crumbs. Toast for 7 minutes, stirring, until golden and crisp. Set aside.
Boil asparagus for 3‚Äì4 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Soft-boil eggs: Return water to a boil. Add eggs and cook for 6 minutes. Transfer to an ice bath, peel, and set aside.
Assemble: Arrange asparagus on plates. Top with halved eggs, drizzle olive oil, sprinkle anchovy bread crumbs, and dab chile paste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipe.name: One-Skillet Bacon-Wrapped Chicken With Dates, Arugula & Blue Cheese
recipe.description: Juicy chicken breasts wrapped in crispy bacon, roasted with Medjool dates and topped with a tangy vinaigrette, served alongside a salad of arugula and blue cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chile sauce (harissa, sambal oelek, or gochujang)
arugula, spinach, or other tender greens
crumbled blue cheese, feta, or goat cheese

steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (375¬∞F for convection). Arrange an oven rack 6 inches from the broiler.
Mix paprika and coriander. Pat chicken dry, rub spice mix evenly on both sides, and season with salt and pepper.
Wrap each chicken breast with two slices of bacon, overlapping slightly, and tuck ends underneath.
Heat olive oil in a 12-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Sear bacon-wrapped chicken seam-side down for 4 minutes until browned.
Mix maple syrup and chile sauce. Brush on chicken tops. Nestle dates around the chicken in the skillet.
Roast for 10‚Äì20 minutes until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 150¬∞F‚Äì155¬∞F, basting with pan sauce occasionally. Remove dates and set aside.
Broil chicken for 2‚Äì4 minutes until the bacon crisps. Rest chicken for 5‚Äì10 minutes before slicing.
Whisk vinegar into the pan sauce to create a vinaigrette. Toss greens with vinaigrette and top with dates and cheese.
Serve chicken alongside the salad, drizzling extra vinaigrette over the chicken.

recipe.name: Saffron Pasta With White Wine & Cream
recipe.description: A luxurious and quick pasta dish featuring saffron-infused sauce with white wine and cream, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes (optional)

steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt it generously.
Crush saffron threads gently and steep in hot water for 10‚Äì15 minutes.
In a saut√© pan, simmer white wine over medium heat until reduced by half, about 3‚Äì5 minutes.
Lower the heat to medium-low, then whisk in 2 tablespoons of butter one at a time until emulsified.
Stir in the cream, saffron liquid, and a pinch of salt. Simmer for 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
Cook pasta according to package instructions or until al dente. If using fresh pasta, cook for 2‚Äì3 minutes.
Reheat the sauce and transfer pasta to the pan using tongs. Add the remaining butter and toss to coat. Adjust the consistency with pasta cooking water if needed.
Serve immediately, garnished with Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes if desired.

recipe.name: Rainbow Noodle Bowl With Garlicky-Gingery Broth
recipe.description: A colorful noodle bowl with roasted sweet potatoes, tatsoi, and a flavorful garlicky-ginger broth, garnished with pickled vegetables and a soft egg yolk.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small sweet potato, peeled and sliced into 1/2-inch coins

steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Toss sweet potatoes in olive oil and roast for 15 minutes. Flip the slices and roast for another 5 minutes until tender.
In a medium saucepan, saut√© garlic in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2‚Äì3 minutes until fragrant. Add ginger and cook for another 5 minutes.
Deglaze the pan with 1 cup of stock, then add remaining stock and fish sauce. Simmer and adjust seasoning.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Add tatsoi to the broth and simmer for 2‚Äì3 minutes until wilted.
Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Place each yolk in a small bowl.
Divide broth and tatsoi between two bowls. Add noodles in the center, creating a well for the yolk. Arrange sweet potato and radish slices along the edges.
Top with pickles, chili sauce, and crispy seasoning. Carefully add the yolk to the well and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Vegetable Soup With Roasted Tomato Pistou
recipe.description: A hearty vegetable soup enhanced with a rich, roasted tomato pistou, customizable with your favorite vegetables and perfect for meal prepping.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Toss cherry tomatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, pepper, thyme, and red pepper flakes. Roast alongside foil-wrapped garlic cloves for 25‚Äì30 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large pot. Saut√© potatoes, carrots, fennel, and leeks with salt until softened and slightly caramelized.
Add rosemary or thyme, then pour in the stock. Stir in white beans and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Add green beans and greens, cooking until tender and vibrant.
For the pistou, pulse roasted tomatoes, garlic (skins removed), fennel fronds, and basil in a food processor. Stream in olive oil until smooth but chunky.
Serve the soup topped with a generous spoonful of pistou. Optionally garnish with cheese or toasted bread.

recipe.name: Milk Street's Lomo Saltado
recipe.description: A Peruvian stir-fry combining soy-marinated beef, tomatoes, onions, and jalape√±os, highlighting the fusion of Chinese and South American cuisine.

ingredients.ingredient_name: sirloin tips, trimmed and sliced into 3-inch strips
red onion, cut into 1/2-inch half rings
jalape√±o chili, thinly sliced into rounds

steps: Combine beef, cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and 2 tablespoons soy sauce in a medium bowl. Marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes. Pat dry and set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch skillet over high heat. Cook half of the beef in a single layer until browned, about 2‚Äì3 minutes per side. Remove and repeat with another tablespoon of oil and the remaining beef.

In the same skillet, heat the remaining oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes, stirring until softened. Stir in vinegar and the remaining 3 tablespoons soy sauce, scraping the bottom of the pan.
Cook for 1 minute until the sauce thickens slightly. Add garlic and jalape√±o and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Return beef to the skillet with its juices. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 30 seconds until the meat is warmed through. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Spinach Rice With Beet Raita
recipe.description: A vibrant and nutritious dish combining spinach-infused rice and beet raita, enhanced with Indian spices and fresh herbs, perfect for potlucks or weeknight meals.
steps: In a blender, pulse coconut, cilantro, green chili, lemon juice, sugar, and ¬Ω teaspoon salt into a smooth paste, adding water if necessary.
Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cashews, cooking until the cashews are golden.
Add red onion, ¬Ω teaspoon salt, and saut√© until soft. Stir in the coconut-cilantro paste and saut√© until fragrant.
Add spinach gradually, saut√©ing until wilted. Mix in any optional add-ins, then remove from heat and fold in cooked rice.
For the raita, heat oil in a small skillet. Add cumin seeds, grated beet, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 3‚Äì4 minutes, then cool.
Whisk yogurt with water until smooth. Mix in the beet mixture and chaat masala. Serve with spinach rice.

recipe.name: Tortellini Salad With Zucchini & Roasted Garlic
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta salad combining cheese tortellini, thinly sliced zucchini marinated with roasted garlic, olive oil, and lemon, topped with Parmesan, basil, and pine nuts.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∫F. Cut the top off the garlic bulb, drizzle with ¬Ω tablespoon olive oil, and sprinkle with salt. Roast for 40‚Äì60 minutes until soft.
Mash 3‚Äì4 roasted garlic cloves in a large bowl. Add 5 tablespoons olive oil, lemon zest, juice, salt, and pepper. Toss zucchini slices in the marinade and let sit for 15 minutes.
Cook tortellini according to package instructions. Drain and let cool slightly.
Combine tortellini, marinated zucchini, Parmesan, basil, and pine nuts in the bowl. Toss to coat evenly.
Garnish with additional basil, Parmesan, and pine nuts if desired. Serve immediately or chill before serving.

recipe.name: Best Kathi Kebab Roll
recipe.description: A classic snack from India and Pakistan, featuring spiced beef kebabs rolled in chapati with chutneys and fresh vegetables, perfect for iftar or suhoor during Ramadan.

ingredients.ingredient_name: garlic cloves, peeled and roughly chopped
fresh cilantro leaves and stems, roughly chopped
green bird‚Äôs-eye chiles, depending on heat tolerance
thinly sliced green cabbage or romaine lettuce

steps: Line a sheet pan with foil and preheat the broiler to high (550¬∞F). Position a rack 5 inches from the heat source.
In a mortar and pestle or food processor, crush or blend garlic, ginger, salt, cilantro, chiles, lemon juice, and olive oil into a paste (about ¬º cup).
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, onion, egg, bread crumbs, garam masala, cumin, coriander, and the cilantro paste. Mix until well combined.
Form the beef mixture into 7-inch-long logs using a 1/3-cup measure or a 2.5-ounce scoop, and place them on the prepared sheet pan.
Broil the kebabs for 15‚Äì20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until well browned and cooked through (internal temperature of at least 160¬∞F).
To assemble the rolls: Place a chapati or naan on a plate. Add a kebab, a teaspoon each of tamarind and cilantro chutney, and a handful of cabbage, onion, and carrot. Roll tightly and serve.

recipe.name: Saz√≥n Ramen
recipe.description: A fusion of Latin American and Asian flavors featuring instant ramen with saz√≥n spice blend, shrimp, spinach, and a garlicky sofrito base, topped with soft-boiled eggs and lime.

ingredients.ingredient_name: diced green bell pepper (about ¬º bell pepper)
instant ramen (any variety), seasoning packets reserved

steps: In a medium pot over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering. Pat shrimp dry and season with ¬º teaspoon salt. Sear in batches until lightly browned and pink, about 30 seconds per side. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium and add the remaining olive oil, onion, bell pepper, and garlic. Saut√© until softened and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water, saz√≥n, dashi, remaining salt, and half a ramen seasoning packet. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Add ramen noodles and cook per package instructions. Remove from heat and stir in spinach until wilted.
Divide soup into bowls and top with shrimp, cilantro, eggs, and sesame seeds if using. Serve immediately with lime wedges.

recipe.name: Herby Pasta Salad With Tempeh Bacon & Roasted Vegetables
recipe.description: A hearty pasta salad featuring roasted vegetables, tempeh bacon, and a fragrant herb dressing, perfect for potlucks, picnics, or meal prep.

ingredients.ingredient_name: finely chopped herbs (mint, basil, oregano, chives)

steps: Preheat oven to 450¬∞F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large serving bowl, whisk olive oil, herbs, vinegar, brown sugar, grated garlic, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Toss broccoli, bell pepper, onion, and tomatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 8‚Äì10 minutes until slightly caramelized.
In a bowl, marinate tempeh with soy sauce, olive oil, vinegar, maple syrup, smoked paprika, and garlic powder for 5 minutes. Roast on a separate sheet for 18‚Äì20 minutes, tossing halfway through.
Cook pasta in salted water according to package instructions. Drain and toss in the herb dressing while warm.
Add roasted vegetables and tempeh bacon to the pasta. Gently toss and season with lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for later.

recipe.name: Autumn Chili Bowl With Roasted Sweet Potatoes & Quinoa
recipe.description: A hearty, plant-based chili featuring roasted sweet potatoes, quinoa, and a warming blend of spices, perfect for fall and winter meals.

ingredients.ingredient_name: medium-size sweet potatoes, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces

steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Toss sweet potato slices with avocado oil, paprika, garlic powder, and salt. Roast on a sheet pan for 35‚Äì45 minutes, flipping halfway through. Set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon avocado oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add half the onion and garlic, saut√© for 2 minutes. Add Impossible Burger and cook until browned, crumbling slightly. Stir in thyme, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a medium pot, heat remaining avocado oil. Saut√© bell pepper, remaining onion, garlic, and ginger for 3 minutes. Add chili powder, cumin, cinnamon, and chipotle powder, cooking for 1 minute.
Stir in pumpkin pur√©e, black beans, black-eyed peas, and tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add corn during the last 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to low, stir in the Impossible Burger mixture and cilantro.
To serve, divide quinoa and roasted sweet potatoes among bowls. Top with chili, vegan sour cream, pumpkin seeds, and additional cilantro.

recipe.name: Whole Fried Fish With Green Papaya Salad
recipe.description: A Thai-inspired dish featuring crispy fried whole fish served with a tangy, spicy green papaya salad, perfect for a flavorful dinner experience.

ingredients.ingredient_name: red Thai bird chiles, thinly sliced
palm sugar or light brown sugar
dried ground shrimp or fresh cooked shrimp, chopped
green papaya, peeled, halved, seeded, and julienned
cilantro leaves and tender stems, chopped
whole fish (such as tilapia, black sea bass, or red snapper)

steps: Using a mortar and pestle, grind garlic and chiles into a chunky paste. Add sugar and shrimp, grinding to a smooth paste. Mix with lime juice, fish sauce, and lime zest to create a dressing.
Add beans to the mortar in batches and bruise lightly. Combine with dressing in a large bowl.
Add peanuts to the mortar, crush lightly, and mix with the dressing. Stir in julienned papaya, tomatoes, cilantro, and scallions. Toss to coat and set aside.
For the fish: Mix lime juice, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, and chiles. Pat fish dry, cut deep diagonal slashes, and coat with marinade. Season with salt and pepper and let sit for 15 minutes.
Dust fish lightly with flour using a sieve.
Heat oil to 325¬∞F in a skillet with any leftover aromatics. Fry fish headfirst until skin is crispy and flesh is cooked, about 3‚Äì4 minutes per side.
Serve fish garnished with mint, cilantro, scallion, and lime wedges alongside the papaya salad.

recipe.name: Andong Jjimdak (Korean-Style Braised Chicken With Vegetables & Glass Noodles)
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful Korean dish combining tender braised chicken, glass noodles, and vegetables in a sweet and savory soy-based sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dangmyeon (Korean glass noodles made from sweet potato)
bone-in chicken (thighs and drumsticks), skin and fat removed
oligo syrup or light corn syrup
dried red chiles, chopped (optional for heat)
firm potatoes (e.g., Yukon Gold), peeled and quartered
carrot, peeled and cut into chunks

steps: Soak glass noodles in cold water for at least 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Prep chicken by removing skin and excess fat. Cut thighs in half and score drumsticks. Blanch chicken in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, syrup, balsamic vinegar, sugar, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large pot, combine parboiled chicken, garlic, ginger, dried chiles, and sauce mixture. Add water and cook partially covered over medium-high heat for 15 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrot, and onion. Reduce heat to medium and cook partially covered for another 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add drained noodles and scallions to the pot, pressing noodles into the sauce. Cook fully covered for 2‚Äì3 minutes until noodles are tender.
Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with sesame seeds and extra black pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipe.name: Nana's New-Style Albondigas Soup
recipe.description: A comforting albondigas soup made with tender meatballs, vibrant vegetables, and a flavorful broth, inspired by a family recipe with a modern twist.

ingredients.ingredient_name: celery heart, stalks cut into bite-sized pieces
carrots, peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces
zucchini squash, cut into bite-sized pieces
long grain white rice, soaked overnight
ground beef (or ground turkey or chicken)

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saut√© onion, tomato, celery leaves, garlic, salt, cumin, and 1 ¬Ω teaspoons oregano until onions are translucent and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add broth and bring to a boil. Add carrots, zucchini, chayote, potato, and celery stalks. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 15‚Äì20 minutes until vegetables are fork-tender.
Strain soaked rice and mix with ground beef, remaining oregano, mint, flour, garlic salt, pepper, and egg. Form into golf ball-sized meatballs (about 20).
Add meatballs to the simmering soup. Return to a boil, add mint sprigs, and simmer for 8‚Äì10 minutes until meatballs float.
Reduce to a low simmer for another 20 minutes until meatballs and rice are fully cooked. Remove mint sprigs, adjust seasoning, and stir in lime juice.
Serve hot and garnish with fresh oregano and additional mint.

recipe.name: Summery Fresh Tomato & Pistachio Pasta
recipe.description: A refreshing pasta dish featuring fresh tomatoes, toasted pistachios, and a garlic-anchovy paste, served at room temperature for a perfect summer meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: very ripe roma tomatoes, cored and chopped

steps: Toss tomatoes with 2 teaspoons of sea salt in a large bowl and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to macerate.
On a cutting board, smash garlic, anchovies, and a pinch of salt into a smooth paste.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside in a large serving bowl.

Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Add macerated tomatoes with their juices, garlic-anchovy paste, and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Pulse until the sauce is smooth but slightly textured.
Mix the tomato mixture with olive oil and toss with the pasta until coated.
Serve pasta at room temperature garnished with basil leaves, cracked black pepper, and extra Parmigiano-Reggiano or olive oil if desired.

recipe.name: Ranch Chicken Cutlets
recipe.description: Crispy, golden-brown chicken cutlets marinated in a tangy ranch-inspired buttermilk brine and coated with seasoned breadcrumbs, perfect for pairing with a salad or sandwiching in a bun.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, halved horizontally and pounded to 1/4-inch thickness

steps: Prepare the brine by mixing salt, garlic powder, onion powder, dill, chives, and hot sauce into the buttermilk. Submerge chicken in the mixture, ensuring it is fully covered. Refrigerate for 6‚Äì12 hours.
Combine panko, flour, nutritional yeast, dill, chives, salt, and black pepper in a shallow bowl to make the breading mixture.
Remove chicken from the buttermilk brine and scrape off any excess liquid. Dredge each piece in the breading mixture, pressing firmly to coat evenly.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and add enough neutral oil to cover the bottom of the pan (about 1/8 inch).
Fry chicken in batches, cooking each piece for 3‚Äì5 minutes per side until golden brown and fully cooked. Avoid overcrowding the skillet.
Transfer cooked chicken to a wire rack to drain excess oil. Serve hot with a salad, in a sandwich, or with coleslaw.

recipe.name: Ramen Scrambled Eggs
recipe.description: Fluffy scrambled eggs infused with the umami-packed flavor of instant ramen seasoning, perfect on rice, toast, or in a tortilla.

ingredients.ingredient_name: thinly sliced scallions or dried ramen vegetables (for garnish)

steps: Crack the eggs into a medium bowl. Add sugar and vinegar, then whisk with a fork until fully combined and aerated.
Melt butter in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Pour in the ramen seasoning, stirring with a spatula to create a loose paste. Toast the seasoning for about 30 seconds.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook undisturbed until the edges begin to set, about 2 minutes.
Turn off the heat and gently fold the eggs from one side to the other using a rubber spatula, forming fluffy curds. Stop folding when the eggs are slightly glossy.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with scallions or dried ramen vegetables. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: White Borscht
recipe.description: A creamy Polish soup made with smoked kielbasa, potatoes, vegetables, and a tangy rye and sour cream base, perfect for Easter or any comforting meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: smoked kielbasa, cut into 3 or 4 pieces
Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and quartered

steps: In a large saucepan, bring kielbasa, potatoes, broth, peppercorns, bay leaves, 1 teaspoon salt, and 4 cups of water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes.

In a heavy stockpot, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onions, stirring occasionally, until softened. Add celery, parsnip, carrots, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add 1 cup of broth from the saucepan to the vegetables. Scrape the pot's bottom to release browned bits. Cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.

Remove kielbasa from the broth and set aside. Check potatoes for doneness. Transfer broth and potatoes to the vegetable pot. Add rye bread, vinegar, black pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Stir in sour cream and parsley until combined.
Slice kielbasa and arrange in bowls with hard-boiled eggs. Ladle soup over and garnish with more parsley. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Smashed Potatoes With Bacon & Eggs
recipe.description: A versatile breakfast-for-dinner dish combining crispy smashed potatoes, fried eggs basted in bacon fat, crunchy greens, and a tangy spicy sour cream drizzle.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large russet potatoes, scrubbed and pricked with a fork
olive oil, plus more as needed
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
scallions, thinly sliced on the bias
crunchy lettuce or tender greens (e.g., arugula, spinach)

steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Place potatoes on a baking sheet and bake until very soft, about 50‚Äì60 minutes. Remove and use a pot lid to smash each potato. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and bake for 15 minutes until crispy. Keep warm in the oven.
Whisk sour cream and hot sauce in a small bowl, thinning with water to a drizzle-able consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-low heat until crisp, about 15 minutes. Remove bacon and set aside. Pour rendered fat into a heatproof container, reserving 3 tablespoons in the skillet.
Fry eggs in batches in the bacon fat over medium heat, basting with hot fat for crispy edges. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, divide greens among plates. Top each with a crispy smashed potato, two fried eggs, crumbled bacon, sour cream drizzle, and scallions.

recipe.name: Citrus Jerk Bass with Fonio
recipe.description: A vibrant and flavorful dish featuring citrus-marinated jerk bass served over a bed of fonio cooked with vegetables and aromatic herbs.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Scotch bonnet pepper, chopped with seeds
bass fillets, skin on and descaled

steps: Blend all the ingredients for the jerk marinade except the fish and fonio until smooth.
Lightly score the skin of the bass fillets and marinate in the jerk sauce for no more than 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Heat a cast-iron grill pan in the oven until very hot.
Remove the fish from the marinade, pat dry, and cook skin-side down in the hot pan for 5‚Äì6 minutes. Flip and cook for 5 more minutes.
In a saucepan, heat olive oil and saut√© ginger, garlic, and shallots until fragrant. Add okra and tomatoes, cooking until the tomatoes burst.
Add rinsed fonio, stir, and pour in 1 1/2 cups of water. Simmer covered on low heat for 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork and mix in Thai basil.
Serve the jerk bass over the prepared fonio.

recipe.name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Black Bean Salad with Chile Dressing
recipe.description: A warm, vibrant salad featuring roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, bell peppers, and fresh cilantro, tossed with a tangy chile-lime dressing.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Place sweet potatoes and onions on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and roast for 30 minutes, stirring halfway through.
In a blender, combine chile, garlic, lime juice, remaining olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
In a large bowl, combine roasted vegetables, black beans, bell pepper, and cilantro. Toss with the dressing.
Serve warm, at room temperature, or refrigerate for up to a day.

recipe.name: Tomato, Cucumber, and Fresh Herb Salad
recipe.description: A refreshing and colorful salad with Persian cucumbers, heirloom tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and an herby sherry vinaigrette, perfect as a light side dish or starter.

ingredients.ingredient_name: small Persian cucumbers, sliced into rounds
ball of fresh mozzarella, torn into chunks
additional basil, parsley, and mint, chopped

steps: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, sherry vinegar, lemon juice, shallot, honey, and chopped herbs to make the dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Prepare the salad: Slice cucumbers, heirloom tomatoes, and cherry tomatoes. Tear mozzarella into bite-size pieces.
In a large serving bowl or platter, combine all salad ingredients. Drizzle with the dressing and toss gently to combine.
Top with additional fresh herbs and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Fried Eggplant With Pork & Fermented Tofu
recipe.description: A Chinese-inspired stir-fry featuring wok-fried eggplant, tender pork, and a bold fermented tofu sauce with aromatic spices.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Chinese or Japanese eggplant, chopped into 2.5-inch pieces

steps: Sprinkle eggplant with salt and let sit for 20 minutes. Press with paper towels to remove excess water.
Heat canola oil in a wok to 375¬∞F. Fry eggplant until browned and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Heat peanut oil in the wok. Saut√© garlic, onion, chile, and ginger with a pinch of salt on low heat for 15 minutes.
Turn heat to high and deglaze with Shaoxing wine. Add fermented tofu, soybean paste, shrimp paste, palm sugar, and white pepper. Saut√© for 3 minutes.
Grind Sichuan peppercorn, coriander, and star anise. Add to the wok and cook for 1 minute.
Return eggplant to the wok. Add soy sauce and stir-fry for 3 minutes. Finish with black vinegar and culantro.

recipe.name: Fall Salad With Lemony Brown Butter Vinaigrette
recipe.description: A vibrant fall salad with roasted carrots, lentils, and radicchio, dressed in a nutty brown butter vinaigrette and topped with fresh herbs and almonds.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Aleppo pepper or red pepper flakes
mixed fresh herbs (parsley, cilantro, mint, or dill)

steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Toast almonds on a baking sheet for 8-10 minutes until fragrant. Cool and gently crush.
Increase oven temperature to 425¬∞F. Toss carrots with olive oil, Aleppo pepper, salt, and black pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes until tender.
Boil lentils in salted water until tender, about 12-15 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat until golden brown and nutty, about 6 minutes. Stir in crushed cumin and fennel seeds.
Whisk lemon juice, zest, Dijon mustard, and honey into the butter mixture. Toss half of the dressing with lentils, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Arrange roasted carrots and radicchio in a serving bowl. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Spoon lentils over the top and sprinkle with herbs, almonds, and flaky sea salt.

recipe.name: Frijoles Charros With Smoked Pork Hocks
recipe.description: A rich and hearty Mexican bean stew flavored with smoked pork hocks, serrano peppers, and traditional spices, perfect as a main dish or a flavorful side.
steps: Drain and rinse the soaked pinto beans and set aside.
Heat lard in a large cast-iron Dutch oven over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced serrano chiles, cooking until the onion softens and browns slightly, about 5‚Äì6 minutes.
Stir in minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add diced tomatoes and cook until they break down into a chunky sauce, about 4‚Äì6 minutes.
Add beans, smoked pork hocks, chicken stock, kosher salt, oregano, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook until beans are tender, about 1 hour.
Remove the pork hocks and set aside to cool. Discard bay leaves. Increase heat to a low boil and reduce the broth slightly for about 20 minutes.
Once pork hocks are cool, remove the skin and excess fat. Shred the meat with a fork and return to the pot along with chopped cilantro.
Adjust seasoning with additional salt if needed. Serve hot with lime wedges and crumbled Cotija cheese.

recipe.name: Spicy Tomato Beans With ‚ÄòNduja
recipe.description: A quick and hearty dish featuring creamy butter beans in a velvety, spicy tomato sauce flavored with ‚ÄòNduja salami, Parmesan, and heavy cream. Perfect for midweek dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ‚ÄòNduja salami, more or less to taste
cans of butter beans, drained and rinsed

steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saut√© garlic and shallot for about 2 minutes until fragrant and translucent.
Add salt, black pepper, Italian seasoning, and tomato paste. Stir to combine. Add ‚ÄòNduja and mix until melted and evenly incorporated.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan until smooth and creamy.
Add butter beans and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle with lemon juice and simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens and becomes glossy.
Garnish with parsley and serve with freshly grated Parmesan and crusty bread.

recipe.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken Pasta
recipe.description: A comforting dish combining creamy Alfredo sauce, fresh basil pesto, and crispy seared chicken, tossed with pasta for a flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
grated Parmesan, plus extra for serving

steps: Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of cooking water.
To make the pesto, blend basil, pine nuts, Parmesan, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until combined but slightly textured.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes until browned. Remove from skillet.

Add remaining butter to the skillet. Saut√© garlic for 2 minutes. Pour in cream, bring to a boil, and stir to dissolve browned bits. Add pesto, cooked chicken, and Parmesan. Stir until cheese is melted. Add reserved pasta water if needed to thin the sauce.
Toss in pasta until evenly coated. Serve with grated Parmesan and toasted pine nuts if desired.

recipe.name: Eggplant Halloumi Stir-Fry
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful stir-fry with creamy eggplant, chewy halloumi, and a savory soy-ginger sauce, perfect for serving over noodles or rice.
steps: Cook the noodles according to package directions. Prepare all ingredients before starting the stir-fry.
Combine cornstarch, soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar, lemon juice, water, brown sugar, sesame oil, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl to make the sauce.
Heat 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking-hot. Stir-fry the eggplant until browned and crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Heat the remaining oil in the same wok. Stir-fry the halloumi cubes until browned, about 2 minutes. Add garlic, onion, ginger, and sesame seeds. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Return the eggplant to the wok and pour in the sauce. Toss frequently for 1‚Äì2 minutes until well coated. Add basil leaves and stir until wilted, about 30 seconds.
Mix in the cooked noodles, toss to coat evenly, and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Tofu Karaage
recipe.description: A vegan twist on the classic Japanese karaage, featuring crispy fried tofu marinated in a savory soy-ginger mixture and served with a creamy garlic aioli.

ingredients.ingredient_name: extra firm tofu, pressed and dried
kosher salt and black pepper (for aioli)

steps: Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, maple syrup, mirin, garlic, ginger, brown sugar, and salt in a bowl to make the marinade.
Cut tofu into bite-size pieces and marinate in the soy-ginger mixture for 30 minutes, gently tossing to coat.
Combine potato starch and cornstarch in a shallow dish. Dredge marinated tofu pieces in the starch mixture until evenly coated.
Heat neutral oil in a frying pan to about 375¬∞F. Fry the tofu in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a wire rack to drain.
Mix mayonnaise, grated garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the aioli. Serve tofu hot with aioli on the side.

recipe.name: Ricotta Polenta with Drunken Meatballs
recipe.description: A rich and satisfying dish with tender meatballs in a savory brown beer gravy served over creamy ricotta-infused polenta.

ingredients.ingredient_name: salt, black pepper, sweet paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder
dried oregano, dried thyme, black pepper

steps: Mix all meatball ingredients in a bowl and shape into 2-tablespoon-sized balls.
Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet. Brown the meatballs on all sides for 10‚Äì12 minutes until cooked through. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, add remaining butter and oil. Cook onions for 5 minutes over low heat. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in oregano, thyme, pepper, and flour. Cook for 1 minute, then pour in brown beer and chicken broth. Add mustard and bring to a boil.
Return meatballs and juices to the skillet. Simmer on low while making the polenta.
Boil chicken stock and milk in a saucepan. Whisk in polenta and cook for 2‚Äì3 minutes. Stir in ricotta, Parmesan, butter, salt, and pepper.
Serve polenta topped with meatballs, gravy, and garnished with chives.

recipe.name: Turkey Avgolemono
recipe.description: A hearty and tangy Greek-inspired soup made with turkey or chicken stock, eggs, lemon juice, and rice, perfect for Thanksgiving leftovers.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cooked chicken or turkey, pulled into pieces

steps: Heat the stock in a large pot over medium heat.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs vigorously until frothy. Gradually add the lemon juice while continuing to whisk.
Slowly drizzle 1 to 2 quarts of hot stock into the egg-lemon mixture, whisking constantly to temper the eggs.
Pour the tempered egg mixture back into the pot with the remaining stock. Add the rice and turkey or chicken.
Bring the soup to a brief boil, then reduce heat and simmer until slightly thickened.
Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Garnish with a drizzle of olive oil and chopped parsley before serving.

recipe.name: Turbo-Charged Xinjiang Big Plate Chicken
recipe.description: An elevated version of Xinjiang's iconic Big Plate Chicken featuring tender chicken, spicy chili paste, and chewy hand-pulled noodles.

ingredients.ingredient_name: green jalape√±os or poblano peppers, diced
red jalape√±os or bell peppers, diced

steps: Prepare hand-pulled noodles: Mix flour, salt, and water to form a dough. Knead until smooth, roll into a sheet, cut, and coat with tapioca starch. Rest for at least 2 hours.
Cut the chicken and marinate with soy sauce, dried chiles, and bay leaves for at least 2 hours.
Blend red bell peppers, doubanjiang, gochugaru, and jam into a pur√©e. Mix all spices in a separate bowl.
In a wok, heat oils and brown the chicken on all sides. Add garlic, ginger, and onion, cooking until fragrant.
Add the pepper pur√©e and cook until it reduces. Deglaze with shaoxing wine, then add stock, fish sauce, bouillon, mustard, spices, and potatoes. Simmer for 15‚Äì20 minutes.
Cook the noodles in boiling water for 2‚Äì3 minutes, then drain and plate.
Add jalape√±os to the chicken mixture, cook briefly, and pour over noodles. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Chinese Tomato & Egg Dough Drop Soup (Geda Tang)
recipe.description: A simple yet comforting Northern Chinese soup featuring velvety broth, dough drops, tomatoes, eggs, and garnished with cilantro and chili oil.

ingredients.ingredient_name: cilantro leaves (or extra scallions), loosely packed

steps: In a small bowl, mix the flour and warm water with chopsticks until smooth and slightly runny. Set aside.
Whisk eggs in a separate bowl until yolks and whites are fully incorporated.
Bring chicken stock to a rolling boil in a small pot.

Heat oil in another medium pot until smoking. Add scrambled eggs, stir quickly, and let them bubble for about 20 seconds. Before the eggs fully set, pour the boiling stock into the pot to create a bubbling, emulsified soup base.
Add tomatoes and scallions to the soup. Season with salt, sugar, MSG, and white pepper. Simmer for 2 minutes.
With the soup simmering, use a ladle and slotted spoon to drop the wet dough through a colander or spoon into the soup to form small dumplings. Bring to a boil and cook until dough is fully cooked.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro leaves and a drizzle of chili oil.

recipe.name: The Five Marys Burger
recipe.description: A gourmet burger featuring flame-grilled beef patties, a selection of condiments like bacon marmalade, tomato jam, and a variety of cheeses, served on soft potato buns.
steps: Prepare a hardwood fire for grilling or heat a grill to medium-high (about 450¬∞F).
Divide ground beef into 12 portions and form into 4-inch round patties. Mix salt, red pepper flakes, rosemary, thyme, sea salt, and black pepper in a small bowl. Season patties evenly.
Grill patties for 6 to 8 minutes, turning once, until well-marked and cooked to the desired doneness.
Butter and toast potato buns on the grill for about 30 seconds until lightly marked.
Assemble burgers with the desired toppings such as lettuce, cheese, tomato jam, and bacon marmalade. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Chopped Salad With Chicken, Peach & Feta
recipe.description: A fresh and flavorful chopped salad featuring grilled chicken, ripe peaches, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and crumbled feta, tossed with a simple red wine vinaigrette.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boar‚Äôs Head FireSmith‚Ñ¢ Flame Grilled Chicken Breast, cut into strips
cherry tomatoes, cut into small cubes
English cucumber or Persian cucumbers, cut into small cubes
avocado, peeled, halved, pitted, and cubed

steps: Heat a large saut√© pan or cast-iron skillet. Cook bacon until crisp, about 10‚Äì12 minutes. Allow bacon to cool, then crumble into ¬Ω-inch pieces.
Prepare the vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper, and oregano until emulsified.
In a large mixing bowl, combine lettuce, chicken, bacon, peaches, cucumber, avocado, tomatoes, and feta. Gently toss using tongs.
Drizzle the salad with vinaigrette and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Momofuku's Soy Sauce Eggs
recipe.description: Soft-boiled eggs marinated in a savory blend of soy sauce, sherry vinegar, and sugar, perfect for snacking or adding to dishes like ramen or rice bowls.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil and prepare an ice bath.
Carefully lower the eggs into the boiling water and cook for 6 minutes.
Transfer the eggs to the ice bath to cool. Once cooled, peel the eggs.
In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, sherry vinegar, and sugar. Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Place the peeled eggs into the soy sauce mixture and marinate for at least 2 hours, turning occasionally.
Serve the marinated eggs as a snack or as a topping for ramen or rice bowls.

recipe.name: Seaweed (Wakame) Colorful Confetti Salad with Sweet Black Sesame Dressing
recipe.description: A vibrant, healthy salad featuring rehydrated wakame seaweed, crisp vegetables, and a sweet, nutty black sesame dressing.
steps: Rehydrate the wakame seaweed by soaking it in warm water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the rehydrated wakame, julienned carrots, cucumber, and red bell pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, and sesame oil to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Garnish with toasted black sesame seeds before serving.

recipe.name: Baked Eggs in Mushrooms and Sausage
recipe.description: A hearty baked dish featuring saut√©ed mushrooms, flavorful sausage, and perfectly cooked eggs, ideal for breakfast or brunch.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Heat a skillet over medium heat and melt the butter.
Add the crumbled sausage and cook until browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, saut√© the sliced mushrooms until softened and golden.
Transfer the sausage and mushrooms to a baking dish, spreading them evenly.
Crack the eggs over the sausage and mushrooms, spacing them evenly.
Drizzle the heavy cream over the eggs and season with salt and black pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15‚Äì20 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny.
Serve hot and enjoy.

recipe.name: Autumn Breakfast (or Anytime) Buckle
recipe.description: A warm, spiced buckle combining apples, pears, and cranberries, topped with a buttery crumble, perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
